&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS\nCREATES TWO KOSHER CHRONS ASSHOLES &nbsp;</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-nX5HybsWkJE/WfOn3WUlKKI/AAAAAAABWYQ/a51A_9X1njYcgBvC-7kpJZ_eaWmtiHQIACLcBGAs/s1600/state-of-blHockchain-q3-2016-48-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"493\" data-original-width=\"638\" height=\"494\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-nX5HybsWkJE/WfOn3WUlKKI/AAAAAAABWYQ/a51A_9X1njYcgBvC-7kpJZ_eaWmtiHQIACLcBGAs/s640/state-of-blHockchain-q3-2016-48-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">On the 18th of June,\nmembers of the Ethereum community noticed that funds were being drained from\nThe DAO and the overall ETH balance of the smart contract was going down.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A total\nof 3.6m Ether (worth around $70M at the time) was drained by the hacker in the\nfirst few hours.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The attack happened due to an exploit found in the splitting\nfunction. The attacker/s withdrew Ether from The DAO smart contract multiple\ntimes using the same DAO Tokens. This was possible due to what is known as a\nrecursive call exploit. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In this exploit, the\nattacker was able to \"ask\" the smart contract (DAO) to give the Ether\nback multiple times before the smart contract could update its own balance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There were two main issues that made this possible: the fact that when the DAO\nsmart contract was created the coders did not take into account the possibility\nof a recursive call and the fact that the smart contract first sent the ETH\nfunds and then updated the internal token balance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It's important to\nunderstand that this bug did not come from Ethereum itself, but from this one\napplication that was built on Ethereum. The code written for The DAO had\nmultiple bugs, and the recursive call exploit was one of them.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Another way to\nlook at this situation is to compare Ethereum to the Internet and any\napplication based on Ethereum to a website - If a website is not working, it\ndoesn't mean that the Internet is not working, it simply means that one website\nhas a problem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The hacker stopped\ndraining The DAO for unknown reasons, even though he could have continued to do\nso.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Ethereum community\nand team quickly took control of the situation and presented multiple proposals\nto deal with the exploit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In order to prevent the\nhacker from cashing in the Ether from his child DAO after the standard 28 days,\na soft-fork was voted on and it was really close to being introduced.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A few\nhours before it was supposed to be released a few members of the community found\na bug with the implementation that opened a denial-of-service attack vector.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This soft fork was\ndesigned to blacklist all the transactions made from The DAO and the fact that\nsuch a soft-fork is not possible to implement means that the Ethereum blockchain\nis immune to transaction censorship.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A more conclusive\nsolution was then put up for vote, the Hard-fork. This hard-fork had the sole\nfunction of returning all the Ether taken from the DAO to a refund smart\ncontract.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The new contract would have only one function: withdraw.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The DAO\ntoken holders can request to be sent 1 ETH for every 100 DAO. The investors\nthat had paid more than 1 ETH for 100 DAO could request the difference from the\noriginal address.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This proposal created a lot of controversy among the Ethereum\ncommunity, which was split into 2 groups: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hard-fork supporters\nand non-supporters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The anti hard-fork\ngroup has the following arguments:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Code is law - the\noriginal statement of The DAO terms and conditions should stand under any\ncircumstances <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Things that happen on\nthe blockchain are immutable and they should never change regardless of what\nthe outcome is<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>There is a slippery\nslope and once you modify / censor for one course/reason there is not a lot to\nkeep you from doing it for other contracts <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The decision to return\nthe money is short sighted and you might reduce the value of ETH down the line\nbased on your decision to act now<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>This is a bailout</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Users that supported\nthe hard fork argued that:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Code is law is too\ndrastic of a statement at the current time and humans should have the final say\nthrough social consensus<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The Hacker could not be\nallowed to profit from the exploit as it is ethically wrong and the community\nshould intervene<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The slippery slope\nargument is not valid as the community is not beholden to past decisions,\npeople can act rationally and fairly in each situation<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>It would be problematic\nto leave such a big piece of the Ether supply in the hands of a malicious actor\nand it might harm the value of Ether down the line<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>This is not a bailout\nas you are not taking money from the community, it is just a return of funds to\nthe original investors<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>It would stop an\nongoing war between the white-hat hackers and the hacker that would demoralize\nthe community and possible continue for many years<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The exploit was big\nenough to take action and reverse it<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>If the community acts\nnow it will make people that are unethical think twice before using Ethereum as\ntheir platform of choice<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>A hard-fork to return\nthe funds would keep regulators and the legal system out of the debate: our\nmess, we fixed it.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In order to reach a\nquick consensus, the hard fork proposal was voted on and approved by Ether\nholders, who had to send a transaction to a voting platform.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The super majority\nof people (89%) voted for the Hard-Fork and it took place during the 1920000th\nblock (20th July 2016). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: x-large;\">This was when Ethereum <span style=\"color: red;\"><b>CHRONS\n</b></span>\u2013nay-- Classic was born.</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The hard fork drew\ncriticism from both within and outside the Ethereum community and was labeled\nas a unilateral act of governance by the Ethereum Foundation that ran contrary\nto its alleged founding values of democratisation and decentralisation.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the\nwidely publicised aftermath, adherents of the strict \"code is law\"\ndoctrine resisted the change and condemned the act by splitting into a\nseparate, parallel blockchain, called Ethereum Classic. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As might have been\nexpected, the hard fork was then followed by two successive forks, aimed at\naddressing ongoing attacks on the network that slowed down transactions and\nsmart contracts, culminating in what were effectively three forks in the space\nof four months. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While the Ethereum\ncommunity appears to have settled on hard forks as a regular way of fixing\ntechnical problems, it is questionable whether hard forks in this manner offer\na sustainable or even satisfactory means of governance for Ethereum and other\nblockchains at large<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The hard fork potential\ninvites the floodgates argument \u2013 if Ethereum intervenes to roll back\ntransactions or sequester funds in this case, what stops stakeholders from\nrequesting and Ethereum from reversing transactions and carrying out successive\ncorrective forks in future smart contract failures?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;While a smart contract may be functionally\nexecutable to the extent that the transfer of assets and payment is all that is\nrequired, in situations where the code does not perform as intended by the\nparties or there is some form of disagreement, there is currently no formal\nredress system to resolve such issues or disputes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To this end, Alternative\nDispute Resolution (\"ADR\") provides parties with the formal means to\nresolve disputes in a private setting and without resorting to courts. This\noffers a two-fold advantage over the informal and unilateral approach taken by\nEthereum. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">First, it transfers\nlegal authority to an independent and experienced arbitrator, who\nuncontroversially is qualified to hear and rule on disputes. Second, it\nelevates computer code to binding contractual provisions and provides a legal\nplatform for recognising and enforcing legal rights in a smart contract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In this respect, not\nonly are arbitrators better placed to consider principles of contract law to\ndetermine what the parties have agreed, but they also have the authority to\nrender a legal judgment that would be enforceable in a court of law. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Naturally, given the\nlack of representative capacity of constituents of the blockchain (i.e.\ndevelopers, creators, or investors) and the lack of recognized legal form of\ndistributed autonomous organisations (\"DAOs\"), which are organisations\nthat are run through rules encoded as smart contracts, ADR provisions would\nneed to be tailored to suit the nuanced requirements of such transactions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Notwithstanding the\nchallenge of developing such a discrete and adaptable set of smart contract\nprovisions, ADR offers an important opportunity to test blockchain technology\ndisputes and develop an effective system of governance that balances the values\nof blockchain immutability with the need for certainty in contracts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">We are &nbsp;still a long way from smart contracts entirely\nreplacing traditional legal contracts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A blockchain runs on a set of nodes, each of\nwhich may be under the control of a separate company, individual or\norganization. These nodes connect to each other in a dense peer-to-peer\nnetwork, so that no one node acts as a central point of control or failure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Each node can generate and digitally sign\ntransactions which represent operations in some kind of ledger or database, and\nthese transactions rapidly propagate to other nodes across the network in a\ngossip-like way.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Each node independently verifies every new\nincoming transaction for validity, in terms of: (a) its compliance with the\nblockchain's rules, (b) its digital signature and (c) any conflicts with\npreviously seen transactions. If a transaction passes these tests, it enters\nthat node's local list of provisional unconfirmed transactions (the 'memory\npool'), and will be forwarded on to its peers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Transactions that fail are rejected outright,\nwhile others whose evaluation depends on unseen transactions are placed in a\ntemporary holding area (the 'orphan pool').<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">At periodic intervals, a new block is\ngenerated by one of the 'validator' nodes on the network, containing a set of as-yet\nunconfirmed transactions. Every block has a unique 32-byte identifier called a\n'hash', which is determined entirely by the block's contents. Each block also\nincludes a timestamp and a link to a previous block via its hash, creating a\nliteral 'blockchain' going back to the very beginning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Just like transactions, blocks propagate\nacross the network in a peer-to-peer fashion and are independently verified by\neach node. To be accepted by a node, a block must contain a set of valid\ntransactions which do not conflict with each other or with those in the\nprevious blocks linked. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If a block passes this and other tests, it is\nadded to that node\u2019s local copy of the blockchain, and the transactions within\nare 'confirmed'. Any transactions in the node\u2019s memory pool or orphan pool\nwhich conflict with those in the new block are immediately discarded.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Every chain employs some sort of strategy to\nensure that blocks are generated by a plurality of its participants. This\nensures that no individual or small group of nodes can seize control of the\nblockchain\u2019s contents.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Most public blockchains like bitcoin use\n'proof-of-work' which allows blocks to be created by anyone on the internet who\ncan solve a pointless and fiendishly difficult mathematical puzzle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">By contrast, in private blockchains, blocks\ntend to be signed by one or more permitted validators, using an appropriate\nscheme to prevent minority control.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Depending on the consensus mechanism used,\ntwo different validator nodes might simultaneously generate conflicting blocks,\nboth of which point to the same previous one. When such a 'fork' happens,\ndifferent nodes in the network will see different blocks first, leading them to\nhave different opinions about the chain's recent history.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These forks are automatically resolved by the\nblockchain software, with consensus regained once a new block arrives on one of\nthe branches. Nodes that were on the shorter branch automatically rewind their\nlast block and replay the two blocks on the longer one. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If we're really unlucky and both branches are\nextended simultaneously, the conflict will be resolved after the third block on\none branch, or the one after that, and so on. In practice, the probability of a\nfork persisting drops exponentially as its length increases. In private chains\nwith a limited set of validators, the likelihood can be reduced to zero after a\nsmall number of blocks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Nonetheless, it's important to remember that\neach node is running on a computer system owned and controlled by a particular\nperson or organization, so the blockchain cannot force it to do anything. The\npurpose of the chain is to help honest nodes to stay in sync, but if enough of\nits participants choose to change the rules, no earthly power can stop them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">That\u2019s why we need to stop asking whether a\nparticular blockchain is truly and absolutely immutable, because the answer\nwill always be no. Instead, we should consider the conditions under which a\nparticular blockchain can be modified, and then check if we're comfortable with\nthose conditions for the use case we have in mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Let us check out the doctrine of immutability\n( like SIX MILLION JEWS DEAD ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">We\u2019ll begin with the claim that the\nconsensual validation procedures used in permissioned blockchains cannot bring\nabout the 'true immutability' promised by public chains.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This criticism is most easily addressed by\npointing to the vulnerability of public blockchains themselves. Take, for\nexample, the ethereum blockchain, which suffered a devastating exploit in June\n2016. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Someone found a coding loophole in a smart\ncontract called The DAO, in which almost $250m had been invested, and began\ndraining its funds at speed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While this clearly violated the intentions of\nthe contract's creators and investors, its terms and conditions relied on the\nmantra that 'code is law'.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Law or not, less than a month later, the\nethereum software was updated to prevent the hacker from withdrawing the\ncryptocurrency 'earned'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Of course, this update could not be enforced,\nsince every ethereum user controls their own computer. Nonetheless, it was\npublicly supported by Vitalik Buterin, ethereum's creator, as well as many\nother community leaders. As a result, most users complied, and the blockchain\nwith the new rules kept the name 'ethereum'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A minority disagreed with the change and\ncontinued the blockchain according to its original rules, earning the title\n'ethereum classic'. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A more accurate choice of names might be\n'ethereum compromised' and 'ethereum the pure'. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Either way, democracy is democracy, and (the\npragmatic and popular) 'ethereum' is now worth over 10x (the idealistic but\nsidelined) 'ethereum classic'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now, let's consider a less benevolent way in\nwhich public blockchain immutability can be undermined. Recall that block\ncreation or 'mining' in bitcoin and ethereum uses a proof-of-work scheme, in\nwhich a mathematical problem must be solved in order to generate a block and\nclaim its reward. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The value of this reward inevitably turns\nmining into an arms race, with miners competing to solve the problems faster.\nTo compensate, the network periodically adjusts the difficulty to maintain a\nconstant rate of block creation, once every 10 minutes in bitcoin or 15 seconds\nin ethereum.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the last five years, bitcoin\u2019s difficulty\nhas increased by a factor of 350,000 times. Today, the vast majority of bitcoin\nmining takes place on expensive specialized hardware, in locations where the\nweather is cold and electricity is cheap.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For example, $1,089 will buy you an Antminer\nS9, which mines blocks 10,000 times faster than any desktop computer and burns\n10 times more electricity. This is all a long way from the democratic ideals\nwith which bitcoin was created, even if it does make the blockchain extremely\nsecure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Well, kind of secure. If someone wanted to\nundermine the immutability of the bitcoin blockchain, here\u2019s how they would do\nit. First, they would install more mining capacity than the rest of the network\nput together, creating a so-called '51% attack'. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Second, instead of openly participating in\nthe mining process, they would mine their own 'secret branch', containing\nwhichever transactions they approve and censoring the rest. Finally, when the\ndesired amount of time had passed, they would anonymously broadcast their\nsecret branch to the network.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Since the attacker has more mining power than\nthe rest of the network, their branch will contain more proof-of-work than the\npublic one. Every bitcoin node will therefore switch over, since the rules of\nbitcoin state that the more difficult branch wins.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Any previously confirmed\ntransactions not in the secret branch will be reversed, and the bitcoin they\nspent could be sent elsewhere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/s2bDEeKHFVw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/s2bDEeKHFVw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">And yet, under the right conditions, the idea\nof allowing blockchains to be modified retroactively via chameleon hashes can\nmake perfect sense.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A chameleon hash can only be used by those who\nhold its secret key. The key is required to enable a new version of a block,\nwith different transactions, to be given the same chameleon hash as before.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Of\ncourse, we probably don\u2019t want centralized control in a blockchain, so we can\nmake the scheme stronger by having multiple chameleon hashes per block, each of\nwhose key is held by a different party.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Or we might use secret sharing\ntechniques to divide a single chameleon hash key between multiple parties.\nEither way, the chain can be configured so that a retroactive block\nsubstitution can only occur if a majority of key holders approve it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Chameleon hashes allow old blocks to be\nsubstituted in a chain far more efficiently than before. Imagine that we need\nto remove a transaction from the start of a blockchain that has been running\nfor five years.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Perhaps this is due to the European Union's right to be\nforgotten legislation, which allows individuals to have their personal data\nremoved from companies\u2019 records. Nodes can't just wipe the offending\ntransaction from their disks, because that would change the corresponding\nblock\u2019s hash and break a link in the chain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The next time the blockchain was scanned or\nshared, everything would fall apart.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To solve this problem without chameleon\nhashes, nodes would have to rewrite the early block without the problematic\ntransaction, calculate the block's new hash, then change the hash embedded in\nthe next block to match. But this would also affect the next block's own hash,\nwhich must be recalculated and updated in the subsequent block, and so on all\nthe way along the chain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While this mechanism is possible in\nprinciple, it could take hours or days to complete in a blockchain with\nmillions of blocks and transactions. Even worse, while engaged in this process,\na node may be incapable of processing new incoming network activity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">So chameleon hashes provide a far more\ncomputationally efficient way to achieve the same goal. If you imagine a bad\ntransaction as a rock buried many miles underground, chameleon hashes can\nteleport the rock to the surface, instead of making us dig all the way down,\nretrieve the rock and fill in the hole.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><b>WHEN IT COMES TO IMPORTANT THINGS LIKE LAND\nREGISTRY\u2014TILL THE BLOCKCHAIN SYSTEM STABILISES , IMMUTABILITY MUST NOT BE\nALLOWED IN INDIA</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/predictive-maintenance-on-chemical.html\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/predictive-maintenance-on-chemical.html</span></a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">One of the IoT's greatest attributes is its\nability to integrate and work with other emerging technologies<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Internet of things (IoT) is the network\nof physical devices, vehicles, home appliances, and other items embedded with\nelectronics, software, sensors, actuators, and network connectivity which\nenable these objects to collect and exchange data<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Artificial intelligence is the simulation of\nhuman intelligence by machines.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">AI supports enhanced IoT applications by\nenabling:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Predictive analytics \u2013 \u2018What will happen?\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics \u2013 \u2018What should we do?\u2019<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Cloud computing is the delivery of computing\nservices\u2014servers, storage, databases, networking, software, analytics and\nmore\u2014over the Internet (\u201cthe cloud\u201d). &nbsp;&nbsp;Companies\noffering these computing services are called cloud providers and typically\ncharge for cloud computing services based on usage, similar to how you are\nbilled for water or electricity at home.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/uroryFU78gM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/uroryFU78gM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Big data analytics is the process of examining\nlarge and varied data sets -- i.e., big data -- to uncover hidden patterns,\nunknown correlations, market trends, customer preferences and other useful\ninformation that can help organizations make more-informed business decisions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/LtScY2guZpo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/LtScY2guZpo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Internet of Things (IoT), Big Data Analytics\nand Cloud Technology are three related technological trends that are\ntransforming how manufacturing and industrial companies are creating value.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/EKRVILAohck/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/EKRVILAohck?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Descriptive analysis does exactly what the\nname implies; they summarize or describe raw data and make it something that is\ninterpretable by humans. It analyzes past events, here past events refer to any\npoint of time that an event has occurred, whether it is one minute ago, or one\nmonth ago.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Descriptive analytics are useful as they allow organizations to\nlearn from past behaviors, and help them in understanding how they might\ninfluence future outcomes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Usually, the underlying data that gets\nanalyzed is a count or aggregate of a filtered column of data. Descriptive\nstatistics are useful in showing things like total stock in inventory or\naverage dollars spent per customer.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Organizations must use descriptive analysis\nwhen they want to understand, at an aggregate level,what is going on in their\ncompany.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Predictive analytics has the ability of\n\u201cPredicting\u201d what might happen next. Predictive analytics is about\nunderstanding the future. Predictive analytics provides organizations with\nactionable insights based on data. Moreover, it also provides estimates of the\nlikelihood of a future outcome.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But, it is equally important to remember that\nno statistical algorithm can \u201cpredict\u201d the future with 100% accuracy.\nOrganizations can use these statistics for forecasting what might happen in the\nfuture. This is because the foundation of predictive analytics is based on\nprobabilities obtained from data.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This relatively new field of prescriptive\nanalytics facilitates users to \u201cprescribe\u201d different possible actions to\nimplement and guide them towards a solution. Prescriptive analysis is all about\nproviding advice. It attempts to quantify the effect of future decisions in\norder to advise on possible outcomes before those decisions are actually made.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics not only predicts what will happen, but also tells why\nit will happen, and thereby provides recommendations regarding actions that\ntake advantage of these predictions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics is complex to\nadminister, and most companies are still not using it. However, when\nimplemented correctly, prescriptive analytics can have a large impact on how\nbusinesses make decisions and thereby, help them in delivering the right\nproducts at the right time, consequently optimizing the customer experience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Looking at all the different types of analytic\noptions can be a daunting task. No one type of analytic is better than the\nother; rather they co-exist with, and complement each other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IoT network generates data that requires a\nnew infrastructure to capture, process and store the same for further access.&nbsp; Cloud storage computing facilitates just\nthat, while facilitating wider and easier access.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Data analytics and machine learning, backed\nby the expansion of computing power, enable companies to extract maximum value\nfrom data to build new offerings.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The convergence of these three technologies\nis creating a massive shift in the belief of value in individual objects to the\ndependence on interconnected devices and the information they generate. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The shift from product orientation to\ninformation-based outcome orientation requires acquisition of certain new\ncapabilities across a range of activities, from product development to sales.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For instance, a company seeking to exploit opportunities in IoT and\nmanufacturing smart devices, will require strong skillsets in data analysis and\ndata management.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The key for any company that wants to\nsuccessfully use big data is gaining the right information that delivers\nknowledge and gives businesses the power to gain a competitive edge. And this\ncan be only be done by identifying and selecting from different types of big\ndata analytics. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Big data analytics should not be considered\nas a one-size-fits-all blanket strategy. What distinguishes the best data\nscientist or data analyst from others is that they have the ability to identify\nthe kind of analytics that can be leveraged for gaining benefits for their\nparticular business line. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There are three dominant types of analytics\navailable today \u2013descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive. These are\ninterrelated solutions that are helping companies to make the most out of the\nbig data that they have. Each of these analytic types offers organizations a\ndifferent kind of insight.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Descriptive analysis does exactly what the\nname implies; they summarize or describe raw data and make it something that is\ninterpretable by humans. It analyzes past events, here past events refer to any\npoint of time that an event has occurred, whether it is one minute ago, or one\nmonth ago.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Descriptive analytics are useful as they allow organizations to\nlearn from past behaviors, and help them in understanding how they might\ninfluence future outcomes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The underlying data that gets analyzed is a\ncount or aggregate of a filtered column of data. Descriptive statistics are\nuseful in showing things like total stock in inventory or average dollars spent\nper customer.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Organizations must use descriptive analysis when they want to\nunderstand, at an aggregate level,what is going on in their company.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Descriptive analytics enables organisations\nto understand their environment and it is similar looking into the rear-view\nmirror of your car; using a variety of structured data sets and statistical\nmethods to achieve insights about what has happened from a second ago to\ndecades ago.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Predictive analytics has the ability of\n\u201cPredicting\u201d what might happen next.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nPredictive analytics is about understanding the future.&nbsp;&nbsp; Predictive analytics provides organizations\nwith actionable insights based on data.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Moreover, it also provides estimates of\nthe likelihood of a future outcome. But, it is equally important to remember\nthat no statistical algorithm can \u201cpredict\u201d the future with 100% accuracy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Organizations can use these statistics for forecasting what might happen in the\nfuture. This is because the foundation of predictive analytics is based on\nprobabilities obtained from data.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">One common application of predictive\nanalytics is to produce a credit score. These scores are used by financial\ninstitutions to determine the probability of customers making future credit\npayments on time.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Predictive analytics improves decision-making\nacross an organisation to understand how to respond to the changing\nenvironment. It is your car\u2019s navigation system that tells you the fastest\nroute despite a traffic jam. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Predictive analytics uses artificial\nintelligence to find patterns and relationships in multiple (un)structured data\nsources to create recommendations. Organisations that use predictive analytics\ngain a competitive advantage, since they can anticipate the future.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics facilitates users to\n\u201cprescribe\u201d different possible actions to implement and guide them towards a\nsolution. Prescriptive analysis is all about providing advice. It attempts to\nquantify the effect of future decisions in order to advise on possible outcomes\nbefore those decisions are actually made.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics not only\npredicts what will happen, but also tells why it will happen, and thereby\nprovides recommendations regarding actions that take advantage of these\npredictions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics is complex to\nadminister, and most companies are still not using it. However, when\nimplemented correctly, prescriptive analytics can have a large impact on how\nbusinesses make decisions and thereby, help them in delivering the right\nproducts at the right time, consequently optimizing the customer experience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics can be seen as the\nfuture of Big Data. If we see descriptive analytics as the foundation of\nBusiness Intelligence and we see predictive analytics as the basis of Big Data,\nthen we can state that prescriptive analytics will be the future of Big Data.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics transforms an\norganisation and is the final stage in understanding a business. It allows a\npermanent and real-time (re)alignment of (in)tangible assets based on\nrecommendations obtained from analysing unstructured and structured data\nsources.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It uses a variety of algorithms and data modelling techniques to offer\nrecommendations on how to take advantage of predictions provided. In\ncontinuation of the car metaphor, it is like a self-driving car bringing you\nautonomously to your destination.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics uses the latest\ntechnologies such as machine learning and artificial intelligence to understand\nwhat the impact is of future decisions and uses those scenarios to determine\nthe best outcome.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With prescriptive analytics, it becomes possible to\nunderstand and grasp future opportunities or mitigate future risks as\npredictions are continuously updated with new data that comes in.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive\nanalytics basically offers organizations a crystal ball. Prescriptive analytics\nwill become really powerful when it has developed into a stage where decision\nmakers can improve their decision-making without the constant need for data\nscientists.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Although prescriptive analytics is still in\nits infancy, there are more and more use cases being developed. Also, several\nBig Data startups focus especially on prescriptive analytics.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The most well\nknow is Ayata. They use patented software to predict what is going to happen,\nwhen it is going to happen and why it is going to happen. They focus primarily\non the oil and gas industry, but there are more use cases of prescriptive\nanalytics. Prescriptive analytics is used in scenarios where there are too many\nvariables, options, constraints and data sets.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Without technology, it is too\ncomplex for humans to efficiently evaluate those scenarios. Also when\nexperimenting in real-life is too risky or expensive, prescriptive analytics\ncan come to rescue.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics is the future of Big\nData, but it is still a long way away before it will be a common language. The\npotential is enormous, but it also requires massive amounts of data to be able\nto make correct decisions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Only a handful of organizations and industries have\nthat amount of data and data sets to make something useful out of it with\nprescriptive analytics. However, in a decade it will be as normal as Business\nIntelligence today.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Prescriptive analytics is still at the\nbudding stage and not many firms have completely used its power. However, the\nadvancements in predictive analytics will surely pave the way for its\ndevelopment. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot;
