Application of the IoT extends to all aspects of\ntransportation systems (i.e. the vehicle, the infrastructure, and the driver or\nuser). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Dynamic interaction between these components\nof a transport system enables inter and intra vehicular communication, smart\ntraffic control, smart parking, electronic toll collection systems, logistic\nand fleet management, vehicle control, and safety and road assistance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In Logistics and Fleet Management for\nexample, The IoT platform can continuously monitor the location and conditions\nof cargo and assets via wireless sensors and send specific alerts when\nmanagement exceptions occur (delays, damages, thefts, etc.). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There are several planned or ongoing\nlarge-scale deployments of the IoT, to enable better management of cities and\nsystems. For example, Songdo, South Korea, the first of its kind fully equipped\nand wired smart city, is on near completion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Nearly everything in this city is\nplanned to be wired, connected and turned into a constant stream of data that\nwould be monitored and analyzed by an array of computers with little, or no\nhuman intervention&nbsp; .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The IoT is especially relevant to the Smart\nGrid since it provides systems to gather and act on energy and power-related\ninformation in an automated fashion with the goal to improve the efficiency,\nreliability, economics, and sustainability of the production and distribution\nof electricity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Using advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) devices connected\nto the Internet backbone, electric utilities can not only collect data from\nend-user connections but also, manage other distribution automation devices\nlike transformers and reclosers <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the business world, chip-making giant\nIntel refers to the IoT as being a \"robust network of devices\" that\nare embedded with electronics, software and sensors. These allow the devices to\nboth exchange and analyze data.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IoT is no longer just the next phase of the\nInternet\u2014it\u2019s fundamentally reshaping the Internet as we know it. With IoT, the\nInternet has been transformed into a real-time conduit of unimaginable amounts\nof data that can be analyzed to make better decisions, improve performance, and\ngrow profits.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The main purpose of IoT devices is to\ngenerate real-time data that we can then analyze and use to create desired\nbusiness outcomes. This requires us to rethink how to architect, monetize and\nsecure our connected systems \u2013 rather than simply connecting as many devices as\npossible. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IoT and its real-time data have now become\nthe foundational launchpad of the next generation of disruptive\ntechnologies\u2014machine learning (ML), drones, autonomous vehicles, blockchain and\nso many more. IoT and its vast amounts of streaming data require the evolution\nof cloud architectures to distributed cloud\u2014or fog computing\u2014to provide\nreal-time or near-real-time analytics at the edge of the network or on devices\nthemselves. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This cloud 2.0 must focus on real-time\nprocessing at scale. IoT must focus on securing all of the \u201cthings\u201d we use in\nour lives and businesses\u2014from smart thermostats to connected vehicles, to\nmilitary drones. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Traditional closed operational systems in\nfactories or buildings are now open and connected, and consumer device vendors\nneed to learn the importance of comprehensive risk management. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain technology is the missing link to\nsettle scalability, privacy, and reliability concerns in the Internet of\nThings. Blockchain technologies could perhaps be the silver bullet needed by\nthe IoT industry. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain technology can be used in tracking\nbillions of connected devices, enable the processing of transactions and\ncoordination between devices; allow for significant savings to IoT industry\nmanufacturers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This decentralized approach would eliminate single points of\nfailure, creating a more resilient ecosystem for devices to run on. The\ncryptographic algorithms used by blockchains, would make consumer data more\nprivate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The decentralized, autonomous, and trustless\ncapabilities of the blockchain make it an ideal component to become a\nfundamental element of IoT solutions. It is not a surprise that enterprise IoT\ntechnologies have quickly become one of the early adopters of blockchain\ntechnologies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain\u2019s use lies in a specific, tailored\napproach to IoT applications to maintain security. And if it truly does reduce\nthe cost and complexity of doing business across a network of people and goods,\n--- this technology will soon become a no-brainer for business.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain opens the door to a series of IoT\nscenarios that were&nbsp; impossible to\nimplement without it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain technology prevents individuals\nand groups from making transactions of assets they no longer have. This ensures\nthat blockchain-backed assets cannot be spent more than once.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Irrespective of the particular nature of an\napplication, IoT typically depends on a central cloud server/gateway for device\nidentification, authentication and data transfer. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now, as the domain of internet usage expands\nacross industries \u2013 establishing such gateways is likely to prove problematic,\nparticularly in remote areas where the connectivity or signal strength is poor.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A blockchain is, by definition,\ndecentralized, and it does away with the need for such centrally located servers.\nInstead, data resides in all the \u2018nodes\u2019 of the distributed, trustless network\n\u2013 ensuring smoother, autonomous operations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Nearly one-fifth of the yearly security\nbudgets of organizations will be accounted for by IoT security expenses in\n2020. Concerns over the reliability of \u2018connected systems\u2019 have been rising \u2013\nwith reports of data hacks, digital identity thefts and distributed\ndenial-of-service (DDoS) becoming rather alarmingly frequent. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchains can easily add an additional\nlayer of security to IoT \u2013 since they do not have vulnerable centralized\nservers, which have been traditionally viewed by malicious agents as single\npoints of attack. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With blockchain technology, a mesh network\ncan be created \u2013 and risks of \u2018data impersonation\u2019 and \u2018device spoofing\u2019 will\nbe kept at an arm\u2019s length. The distributed ledger is immutable, ensuring that\ndata/transaction records cannot be modified or deleted by unauthorized hackers.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Even if someone goes through the trouble of\naltering each stage in the overall chain, the process would be too costly and\ntroublesome. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A distributed, decentralized control would\nfacilitate higher latency and throughput levels, while ruling out chances of\nsecurity breaches. The blockchain technology enables IoT devices to exchange\nprotected, trustless messages among smart devices \u2013 making them truly\n\u2018autonomous\u2019.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts, pre-specifying the rules of the transactions (generally as \u2018if-then\u2019 condition statements) can be created between two\nparties easily, ensuring that operations can be managed remotely \u2013 and without\nthe interference of a human agent/centralized brokerage system. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For instance, a \u2018smart irrigation\u2019 system can\nbe \u2018instructed\u2019 to release/stop the flow of water by the field sensors. The\ntrustless messaging system powered by blockchains can be just like the\ncommunications in a bitcoin network. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The absence of a central control unit also\nreduces the required processing times and speeds up data exchanges \u2013\nestablishing accelerated data exchanges. The distributed ledger system offers\neasy scalability, and can deliver improved security to the expanding sets of\nsmart gadgets.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">What\u2019s more, it also become fairly simple to locate a\ncompromised device (for instance, captured in a botnet or infected with\nmalware), and prevent it from putting the health of the entire system (which\ncan be a smart home, an enterprise setup, or even a smart vehicle network) at\nrisk. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Additional devices can be supported in a\nblockchain infrastructure, without any significant need for extra resources.\nBlockchain transactions take place after mutual trustless consensus of all the\ninterested parties in the network. A single, secure record of all the\ntransactions is maintained in the distributed ledger. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Since tampering with these records is, for\nall practical purposes, impossible \u2013 potential confusions over the ownership of\ndigital assets are ruled out. The level of transparency of the recordkeeping is\nfurther enhanced by the fact that each IoT transaction on the platform is\ntimestamped. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Individual users and organizations are\nencouraged by the trustworthiness of blockchains \u2013 built by the device\ninformation records and transaction/ exchange records maintained in the ledger.\nThe communications might be named \u2018trustless\u2019 (since the transacting parties\nare not acquainted, and generally use pseudonyms)\u2026but blockchains actually\nbuild trust in IoT frameworks in a big way. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The \u201851 percent attack\u2019 problem (changes in\ntransaction records can be validated, provided 51% of the blockchain network\napprove it) is, arguably, the biggest point of concern \u2013 particularly when\nblockchain is used in relatively small IoT systems ( home / office). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There is no scope of doubting the importance\nof blockchains in IoT \u2013 but a few rough edges have to be ironed out, for\nrealizing the full benefits of the technology.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain, together with artificial\nintelligence, machine learning, robotics, and virtual and augmented reality,\nhave the potential to deliver disruptive outcomes and reshape digital business\nin 2018. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">And companies that have not started the\ndigital investment cycle are at high risk of being disrupted Companies that\nhave not started digital investments yet in technologies like Blockchain,\nartificial intelligence, machine learning robotics and virtual and augmented\nreality are at high risk of being disrupted.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These technologies, especially Blockchain,\nhave the potential to deliver disruptive outcomes and reshape digital business\nin 2018 .. Blockchain, together with artificial intelligence, machine learning,\nrobotics, and virtual and augmented reality, have the potential to deliver\ndisruptive outcomes and reshape digital business in 2018.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hackers can shut down entire networks, tamper\nwith data, lure unwary users into cybertraps, steal and spoof identities, and\ncarry out other devious attacks by leveraging centralized repositories and\nsingle points of failure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The blockchain\u2019s alternative approach to\nstoring and sharing information provides a way out of this security mess..\nBlockchains can increase security on three fronts: blocking identity theft,\npreventing data tampering, and stopping Denial of Service attacks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) is a popular\nform of public key cryptography that secures emails, messaging apps, websites,\nand other forms of communication. However because most implementations of PKI\nrely on centralized, trusted third party Certificate Authorities (CA) to issue,\nrevoke, and store key pairs for every participant, hackers can compromise them\nto spoof user identities and crack encrypted communications. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A public key infrastructure (PKI) is a set of\nroles, policies, and procedures needed to create, manage, distribute, use,\nstore, and revoke digital certificates and manage public-key encryption. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The purpose of a PKI is to facilitate the\nsecure electronic transfer of information for a range of network activities\nsuch as e-commerce, internet banking and confidential email. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It is required for activities where simple\npasswords are an inadequate authentication method and more rigorous proof is\nrequired to confirm the identity of the parties involved in the communication\nand to validate the information being transferred..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;In\ncryptography, a PKI is an arrangement that binds public keys with respective\nidentities of entities (like people and organizations). The binding is\nestablished through a process of registration and issuance of certificates at\nand by a certificate authority (CA). Depending on the assurance level of the\nbinding, this may be carried out by an automated process or under human\nsupervision.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The PKI role that assures valid and correct\nregistration is called a registration authority (RA). An RA is responsible for\naccepting requests for digital certificates and authenticating the entity\nmaking the request. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The public key infrastructure (PKI) security\nmethod is used to implement strong authentication, data encryption and digital\nsignatures. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KSI is a blockchain technology to make sure\nnetworks, systems and data are free of compromise, all while retaining 100%\ndata privacy. . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The integrity of an event or a digital asset\nregistered using KSI allows verification of three things: proof of time,\nidentity and authenticity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Unlike traditional approaches that depend on\nasymmetric key cryptography, KSI uses only hash-function cryptography, allowing\nverification to rely only on the security of hash functions and the\navailability of a public ledger.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This guarantees data integrity without the\nneed to keep secrets. In short, instead of putting all of the data up in the\nblockchain, they only take fingerprints of the data.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Keyless Signature Infrastructure (KSI), a\nreplacement for the more traditional Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), which\nuses asymmetric encryption and a cache of public keys maintained by a\ncentralized Certificate Authority (CA).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">With the help of a blockchain-based\ntechnology, known as keyless signature infrastructure (KSI), the public keys\ncan be securely managed, which eliminates the risk of breach.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Keyless signature infrastructure relies on\nthe use of hash function cryptography as compared to the traditional asymmetric\nkey cryptography used in public key infrastructure, and provides real-time\nsignature validation to ensure comprehensive enterprise security<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Keyless Signature Infrastructure (KSI), a\nreplacement for the more traditional Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), which\nuses asymmetric encryption and a cache of public keys maintained by a\ncentralized Certificate Authority (CA).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KSI can detect advanced persistent threats\n(APTs) which work to remain hidden in networks. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Through the properties of verifiable\nauthenticity, identity of the client, and non-global positioning system-based\nnon-spoofable time; KSI provides provenance, integrity and identity associated\nwith digital assets. This implementation consumes far less storage and bandwidth\nthan widely proliferated blockchain technology and can provide the above\ndefined attributes for thousands of files a second scalable to billions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KSI\ncryptographically links data assets with immutable properties provided by the\nKSI infrastructure, and implemented in a KSI signature.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KSI promises this\nadditional integrity and authenticity in newly created or already existing data\nwhether on the network, in embedded systems or traversing the cloud. Customers who\nimplement KSI can prove their current and future information systems are in a\ntruthful state and meet business and mission needs with increased security.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KSI\nwas designed with considerations for security, scalability, and speed to meet\nthe requirements for a host of complex applications. KSI uses a \u2018proof-based\u2019 method\nto accomplish authentication and our signature is portable across any computing\nplatform.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KSI signatures are based on mathematical proofs and keyless\ncryptographic functions&nbsp; .. KSI addresses\nthe need to prove data integrity and detect changes in data &nbsp;authenticity at rest and in motion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KSI is designed to provide secure, scalable,\ndigital, signature-based &nbsp;authentication\nfor electronic data, machines and personal information. Unlike traditional\napproaches that depend on asymmetric key cryptography, KSI uses only\nhash-function cryptography, allowing verification to rely only on the security\nof hash-functions and the availability of the history of cryptologicallylinked\nroot hashes (the blockchain).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The KSI blockchain overcomes two of the major\nweaknesses of traditional blockchains, speed and storage capacity, making it\nusable at industrial scale.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">One of the most significant challenges with\ntraditional blockchain approaches is scalability; typically they grow linearly\nwith the number of transactions. In contrast the KSI blockchain scales\ntemporally; it grows linearly with time and independent from the number of\ntransactions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The second significant challenge is time to record an individual\ntransaction. Some refer to this as settlement time for a large number of nodes\nto witness a transaction often taking many minutes to complete a transaction.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In contrast KSI has a straightforward mathematical process that provides\nsignatures on the order of one second, that is once a second generating\nsignature for thousands of client requests.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The KSI approach to implementing digital\nintegrity is to provide a secure infrastructure consisting of cores,\naggregators, and gateways to create keyless signatures. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The security appliance comes with a built-in\nKSI gateway, which allows for secure implementation of KSI-based data assurance\nand cybersecurity solutions with built-in active anti-tamper measures..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Digital data signed by a KSI signature is\ncryptographically linked to the data. Digital data of any format, protocol, or\nsize can be signed. The data\u2019s signature is preserved in the calendar blockchain,\nwhich provides longevity and becomes an irrefutable record available to the\npublic for verification.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KSI signatures provide proof of signing time, proof of\nsigning entity, and data integrity. The signature of the data will now be\navailable in perpetuity, unlike a PKI-based digital signature. If a private PKI\nkey or certificate is compromised, the PKI digital signature must now be\nrevoked.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A KSI signature cannot be revoked and does not need to be. KSI can be used\nin conjunction with PKI as desired to protect the longevity of PKI\ncertificates. KSI is&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">intended to protect integrity of an asset\nwhile PKI is intended to protect its confidentiality.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These are different attributes. In the\nspecific example of medical records, loss of confidentiality may results in\nembarrassment while the loss of integrity may result in the loss of life from\nthe administration of healthcare based on incorrect information. Both have\ntheir purpose.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">KSI is focused more on integrity of\nprocesses, supply chains and the &nbsp;authenticity\nof digital data. KSI does not expose client data to a large number of entities,\nclient data never leaves client possession.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Advanced persistent threat [APT] is a\nmilitary term adapted into the information security context that refers to\nattacks carried out by nation-states. &nbsp;APT-related threats are created by a group of\ndevelopers using in-house tools that are not usually found in the cybercriminal\nunderground. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">APT is usually mixed-up with the term\n\u201ctargeted attacks\u201d due to the complex nature of both. While targeted attacks\nalso involve complex stages similar to APT, their targets are different;\ntargeted attacks aren't carried out by nation states. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">APTs are more sophisticated in nature and\nrequire deft knowledge and skills to execute. Since APTs are state-sponsored\nattacks, their operation usually lasts longer. It is also typical of APT\nattacks to go after a country\u2019s infrastructure, such as its power grids,\nnuclear reactors, or fuel pipelines.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/it6cdHpLWG4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/it6cdHpLWG4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Legal frame work has to be modeled to include\nBlockchain technology. Laws and regulations relating to blockchain technology\nand cryptocurrencies can be divided into two categories: --</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">(1) enabling and (2)\nprohibitive.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There is certain legislation&nbsp;\nthat enables blockchain technology to be more fully utilized for all of\nits various use cases.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">One example is digital signature enabling legislation.\nSubject to certain exceptions (e.g. consumer loan documents), digital\nsignatures are generally recognized as a valid signature throughout the&nbsp; world.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This allows smart contracts to\nauthenticate and validate transactions in a legally binding manner and also\nallows private keys and other digital signatures to be recognized as a valid\nform of signature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">On the other hand, most laws, rules and\nregulations prohibit or restrict certain types of activities, or require\ncertain actors to behave in a certain way. Several such existing regulations\napply to blockchain technology and cryptocurrency, depending on the specific\nnature of the use case.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The primary areas of law impacting blockchain\ntechnology and cryptocurrency are as follows:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Many blockchain use cases, particularly token\nsales and other issuances of cryptocurrency, potentially implicate U.S. and\ninternational securities laws. In the United States, the primary test for\nwhether or not something is a security (or investment contract) is called the\nHowey Test.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Howey Test provides that the thing being assessed (e.g. a\ntoken) is a security if three elements are met: (1) there is an investment of\nmoney, (2) in a common enterprise, and (3) an expectation of profits\npredominantly from the effort of others.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Whether or not each of these three\nelements is met often depends on the specific facts and circumstances of the\nitem being offered. Additionally, there is a robust body of case law that\nfurther informs and clarifies what each of the three above elements mean and\nencompass.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>A long time ago, someone named Howey owned an\norange grove.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Howey said: \"I've got this orange grove\nand I've got no way to make money out of it \u2013 because I need money to make\nmoney.\"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Tell you what. I'm going to sell you this\norange grove and, in exchange, you get whatever profits are made from that\nlittle plot.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>I'll work the land. I'm going to pick the\noranges. I'm going to squeeze the juice. You just pay me the money.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The plaintiffs said: \"That's a\nsecurity.\"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The SEC said: \"That's a security.\"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Howey said: 'No, no. That's just selling\nplots of oranges.\"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Ultimately, the Supreme Court said:\n\"That's a security\" \u2013 because it passed this test: There was an\ninvestment of money. And a common enterprise. With the expectation of profit,\nprimarily from the efforts of others.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>We might adapt this ultra-modern scenario to\nthe decades-old tale:<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Not so long ago, a group of developers\nstarted a DAO.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The DAO developers said: \"There are all\nthese decentralized projects and there's no way for them to get funding \u2013\nbecause they need money to make money.\"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Tell you what. We're going to write code and\nsell a token and, in exchange, people who buy the token will get whatever\nprofits are made from those projects.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>We'll work the code. They'll pick the\nprojects. The projects will flourish and everyone will profit.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The SEC said: \"That\u2019s a security.\"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>The DAO developers said: \"No, no. That's\njust selling tokens.\"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><i>Ultimately, the SEC said: \"That's a\nsecurity\" \u2013 because of the application of the Howey Test: There was an investment\nof money. And a common enterprise. With the expectation of profit, primarily\nfrom the efforts of others.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the context of blockchain tokens, the\nHowey test can be expressed as three independent&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">elements (the third element encompasses both\nthe third and fourth prongs of the traditional Howey&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">test).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">All three elements must be met in\norder for a token to be a security.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">1. An investment of money<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">2. in a common enterprise<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">3. with an expectation of profits\npredominantly from the efforts of others.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/h_aTK8epmSE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/h_aTK8epmSE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Each company or organization pursuing a\nblockchain-related initiative should be familiar with the regulatory framework\napplicable to that initiative.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Additionally, due to the rapid growth of the\nindustry, we can expect to see new regulations (and clarifying guidance on\nexisting regulations) emerge over the next few years as lawmakers try to catch\nup with the disruptive change being brought about by blockchain technology.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;There\nis a difference between smart contract code, which refers to code that is\ndesigned to execute certain tasks, and a smart legal contract, which refers to\nelements of a legal contract being represented and executed by software.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A\nsmart contract is an agreement in digital form that is self-executing and\nself-enforcing..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts are no legal contracts but\nsimply computer codes. More specifically, smart contracts are stand-alone\nprograms that, once programmed, automatically execute previously defined\nconditions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">They have three main characteristics: increased speed, better\nefficiency and certainty that the contract will be executed as agreed. These\nprograms reduce the costs of verification, enforcement, arbitration and fraud.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The advantage of setting up smarts contracts\nin a blockchain is to ensure that the terms of the contract cannot be changed. &nbsp;&nbsp;Translated into the blockchain world, a smart\ncontract is a program written by a user in order to carry out a transaction\nwith other users on the blockchain, who accept the terms of that transaction.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A\nsmart contract can thus be legally assimilated to an accepted offer and\ntherefore, to a contract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts are legally enforceable if done the right way.&nbsp; &nbsp;There is no reason to think one cannot make a contract in computer code or\nelectronically. Contract law has all sorts of requirements. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For example, we cannot make an illegal\ncontract. Smart contracts are operating independently of the surrounding legal\nframework, but those who wish to use smart contracts will have to deal with\nlegal issues regardless. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Lawyers familiar with coding can convert a\ntraditional term sheet into a smart term sheet by identifying which contract\nterms, as well as practical and legal details, will be implemented as a smart\ncontract and which, if any, will not.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Key algorithms for performing parties'\nintentions can be specified. Legal issues can be identified and addressed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Those important issues should not be left by\nthe contracting parties to a software developer\u2019s sole discretion. By creating\na smart term sheet, the parties can also integrate the advice of counsel into\nthe instructions given to the software developer.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For example, the term sheet\ncould decide to take priority over the code if there were to be conflict\nbetween the two.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Since the blockchain does not factor the real\nworld, the lawyer\u2019s added-value would also be to identify what\ncriteria/indicators would trigger the execution of the contract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The lawyer would become a so-called \u201coracle\u201d,\na trusted third party making the link between the real world and the\nblockchain, by entering external verifiable data, or identifying who will\nprovide the relevant information into the blockchain, in order to ensure that\nthe contract will be correctly self-executed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While restraining the discretionary powers of\nthe software developer, room for error is limited.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The blockchain and the use of smart contract\nwill take us to the next legal revolution in contractual law. Lawyers will have\nto learn a new expertise, that of the code. Equally, the blockchain requires\nthat developers will need to know more about legal implications.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">On the one hand, lawyers often look at smart\ncontracts as if it was science fiction, without fully grasping the potential of\nblockchain-code.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">On the other hand, developers explore the\ndiversity that smart contracts would offer without factoring commercial and\nliability implications reflected in traditional legal agreements.&nbsp; Both must learn from the other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Certain operational clauses within legal\ncontracts lend themselves to being automated. Other&nbsp; non-operational clauses \u2013 for instance, the\ngoverning law of a contract \u2013 are less susceptible&nbsp; to being expressed in machine-readable code.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Some legal clauses are subjective or require&nbsp;\ninterpretation, which also creates challenges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A possible near-term application of a smart\ncontract is for the legal contract to remain in natural legal language, but for\ncertain actions to be automated via a smart contract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This would require those actions \u2013 for\ninstance, payments and deliveries \u2013 to be represented in a&nbsp; more formal, standard way within the ISDA\nDefinitions, enabling them to be read by machines.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A critical point to recognise, however, is\nthat a smart contract is not the same thing as a legal contract. Indeed, an\naphorism often repeated is that the term \u2018smart contract\u2019 is a misnomer because,\nin many cases, a smart contract is neither smart nor a contract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To a lawyer, a legal contract has a distinct\nmeaning:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A contract is an agreement giving rise to\nobligations which are enforced or recognised by law. The factor which\ndistinguishes contractual from other legal obligations is that they are based\non the agreement of the contracting parties<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">.</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-lpgPORuZyxM/WfI8b4diXgI/AAAAAAABWXI/qE9bWrD8yagKhgJDepIC6s8ddg5nj33pACLcBGAs/s1600/dowwanload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"200\" data-original-width=\"252\" height=\"317\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-lpgPORuZyxM/WfI8b4diXgI/AAAAAAABWXI/qE9bWrD8yagKhgJDepIC6s8ddg5nj33pACLcBGAs/s400/dowwanload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For a contract to be valid, legal systems\nwill impose certain requirements. Under&nbsp;\nlaw, there are four key elements that must (usually) be satisfied: --</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">(i)\none of the contracting parties must make an offer to contract and the other(s)\nmust accept that offer;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">(ii) there must be \u2018consideration\u2019 for the offer, this\nbeing some form of value that must be exchanged;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">(iii) the parties must have an\nintention to form legal relations; and&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">(iv) there must be certainty as to terms\nof the contract. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Other systems of law may have other\nrequirements \u2013 for example, under New York law, many legal contracts must be in\nwriting and signed to become binding.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For a smart legal contract, there would need\nto be a legal contract satisfying the requirements of the relevant governing\nlaw, but with some element of that legal contract being electronically\nautomated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With smart contract code, in contrast, there\nmight exist no legal contract at all.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Take the example of a software agent that is\nformulated so a pre-defined amount of an asset is moved from an account of one\nperson (A) to another (B) if a pre-determined condition is met.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This software agent\ndoes not create legal obligations between A and B. It does not impose a legal\nobligation on A to transfer the asset; it simply provides that a transfer will\ntake place if the relevant condition is satisfied.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This begs the question of\nwhy A would initiate such a software agent if not to satisfy a legal obligation\nto B<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">And if the software agent is designed to\nsatisfy a pre-existing legal obligation, then that would seem to be an instance\nwhere smart contract code facilitates a smart legal contract, as previously\ndescribed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A smart contract does not possess CONSCIOUS\nintelligence. All it does is execute pre-programmed steps.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">What would be necessary in order to turn this\nsmart contract code from mere code into binding legal obligations? &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-grUN_frCAN4/WfI8qRsItGI/AAAAAAABWXM/aVaRh2J2Mkos8UjV0UEbMEMlZcuZ0V7gwCLcBGAs/s1600/019af7a8cc9fd5cf3cf66ddbcf6912520--law-school-quotes-law-school-funny.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"398\" data-original-width=\"393\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-grUN_frCAN4/WfI8qRsItGI/AAAAAAABWXM/aVaRh2J2Mkos8UjV0UEbMEMlZcuZ0V7gwCLcBGAs/s400/019af7a8cc9fd5cf3cf66ddbcf6912520--law-school-quotes-law-school-funny.jpg\" width=\"393\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Under&nbsp;\nlaw, the four key elements for a contract must be satisfied. First,\nthere needs to be offer and acceptance. The initialisation of the software\nagent does not represent offer and acceptance by&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">itself.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">However, what if A sends B a\nmessage saying, \u201cI offer to you that I will initialise this software agent and\nthe actions of the software agent represent my legal obligations to you. Do you\nagree?\u201d, and B then responds \u201cI agree\u201d? That would satisfy the requirement for\noffer and acceptance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">Secondly, there must be consideration (or value) that\npasses between the parties. In the example given, there are only one-way\nobligations: A has received nothing in return for its transfer of an asset to\nB.
