font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">One of the primary tenets of the\nReliability Centered Maintenance approach is that maintenance activities should\nbe focused toward preserving equipment functionality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A program is RCM if it:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">1) Is scoped and\nstructured to preserve system function<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">2) Identifies failure\nmodes, which are the ways in which something might fail. Failures are any\nerrors or defects, especially ones that affect the customer, and can be\npotential or actual<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">3) Addresses failure\nmodes by importance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">4) Defines applicable\nmaintenance task candidates and selects the most effective one in the case of\nimportant failure modes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/predictive-maintenance-on-chemical.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/predictive-maintenance-on-chemical.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/goodies-on-new-build-chemical-tankers.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/goodies-on-new-build-chemical-tankers.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UQ3UWpGc7kI/We9B8lnU4iI/AAAAAAABWUo/fpzQdBfIU4M1OK6CyXonAwOWJa_1cr0OACLcBGAs/s1600/InsuraJnce-Fraud.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"350\" data-original-width=\"660\" height=\"338\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UQ3UWpGc7kI/We9B8lnU4iI/AAAAAAABWUo/fpzQdBfIU4M1OK6CyXonAwOWJa_1cr0OACLcBGAs/s640/InsuraJnce-Fraud.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A research paper by IBM reveals that the\nexisting methods of storing and reconciling financial data\u2014the pillars of\ninsurance claims operations\u2014are too complex and fragmented. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">At the same time, organizations that are\nincluded in the workflow are reluctant to share their data due to obvious\nreasons:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The risk of disclosing information that is\neasily identifiable to be further associated with a person.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sharing data across borders means having to\nabide by multiple laws and regulations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Insurers are unwilling to share sensitive\nloss information to competitors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Some insurers may want a central authority to\nmanage the shared data.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The free-rider problem occurs, implying that\nlarger KOSHER organizations contribute more and get less than the smaller NON-KOSHER\nones.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Though such policies as the Medicare Access\nand CHIP Reauthorization Act (MACRA) are seen by governmental institutions as a\nmeans to enable interoperability, insurance providers experience certain\ndifficulties\u2014imposed by workflow issues and vendor costs/capabilities of the\nelectronic health record (EHR)\u2014when sharing data.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain\u2019s biggest asset \u2013 decentralization\n\u2013 is also its biggest weakness in the digital advertising space. &nbsp;&nbsp;Due to its distributed nature, where\ntransactions are verified by \u201cminers\u201d around the world, blockchain technology\nsimply can\u2019t analyze or process real-time advertising transactions fast enough.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<b><br /></b></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HrL9tMXYLiI/We-sQY7QOZI/AAAAAAABWU8/J-n7691atS8mePylxvdlz1ZxNpi5SA56wCLcBGAs/s1600/AAEAAQAAAhAAAAA3GAAAAJDZkYzc5MWM5LWYwY2UtNDcxOC04NzgyLTM1MWIzNTMzNjExYg.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"323\" data-original-width=\"600\" height=\"344\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HrL9tMXYLiI/We-sQY7QOZI/AAAAAAABWU8/J-n7691atS8mePylxvdlz1ZxNpi5SA56wCLcBGAs/s640/AAEAAQAAAhAAAAA3GAAAAJDZkYzc5MWM5LWYwY2UtNDcxOC04NzgyLTM1MWIzNTMzNjExYg.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A DSP or Demand Side Platform is the platform\nthat aggregates traffic from the multiple ad exchanges and SSPs (Supply Side\nPlatform), thus helping advertisers find as much traffic as possible with the\ncheapest market price.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DSP bids are based on the RTB (Real-Time\nBidding) system on behalf of advertisers.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">The ad will then be displayed on the web page\nof the advertiser with the highest bid.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">The system minimizes the number of wasted\nimpressions, helping advertisers cut costs.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Demand-Side Platform, &nbsp;is a software that is used for programmatic ad\nbuying, typically via bidding in RTB auctions.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DSPs are commonly used by\nadvertisers, in-house marketing teams, advertising agencies or Agency Trading\nDesks (ATDs).&nbsp; &nbsp;Demand-Side Platforms (DSPs) are used by\ndigital advertising buyers \u2014 advertisers, agencies, ad networks \u2014 to help them\nmanage programmatic ad buying across ad exchanges. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DSPs are the flip side of supply-side\nplatforms, which are software platforms used by publishers to manage the sale\nof their digital advertising inventory on ad exchanges.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Whereas SSPs are used to help publishers sell\nas much inventory at as high a price as possible, DSPs are used by digital ad\nbuyers to reach their target audiences and bid in automated auctions as\nefficiently as possible. &nbsp;&nbsp;DSPs automate\nthe ad-buying process, reducing the need for back-and-forth negotiations\nbetween media buyers and sellers. &nbsp;DSPs\ncan pull in data from multiple sources to target audiences and inform bidding\nstrategies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Publishers make data available that can be\nused for contextual targeting, as well as information about the user that has\ntriggered an impression, such as demographics, location, device or browsing and\npurchase history.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With a DSP, digital advertising buyers can\naccess inventory across multiple ad exchanges. The DSPs automatically analyze\nwhich ad impressions are worth bidding on and at what price in a process known\nas real-time bidding. The analysis and auction take just milliseconds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Much of the power of DSPs comes from their\nability to automate decision-making on how much to bid on an ad impression in\nreal time \u2014 the moment it becomes available on a publisher\u2019s website or app \u2014\nbased on the advertiser\u2019s targeting requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DPSs can be used to buy most types of digital\nadvertising, including display, mobile, search and video.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the early days, digital ads were bought\nand sold by ad buyers and salespeople. DSPs were designed to minimize the need\nfor negotiations between media buyers and publishers, making the process\ncheaper and more efficient. With the appearance of DSPs, the need for manual\nnegotiation of the price has been completely eliminated.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">DSPs are the flip side of SSPs (Supply-Side\nPlatforms). </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">DSPs serve the buyer side. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">Buying ad space in real-time through DSPs\ngives advertisers the ability to place the ad copy to the target audience in\nthe right time and context.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Since a publisher creates the inventory\nspace, the publisher has the power to define the URL, location, and content\ncategory that is placed into the bid stream through the supply-side platforms\n(SSPs). &nbsp;&nbsp;The ad buying process goes like\nthis. A publisher creates a bid request and sends it to several supply-side\nplatforms and ad exchanges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An SSP or Supply Side Platform is the\nequivalent of a DSP, but on the publisher side.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An SSP is a platform that helps webmasters automate\nand optimize the process of selling traffic by providing valuable statistics\nsuch as the number of visitors, time spent by visitors, and % of visitors\nreturning to a specific website.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Supply-side platforms&nbsp; (SSPs) help publishers sell digital ad\nimpressions in automated auctions. Publishers can sell and manage display,\nvideo or native ad inventory on desktop and mobile through SSPs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Supply-side\nplatforms \u2014 also called sell-side platforms or yield optimization platforms \u2014\nare used by digital publishers to manage the sale and fulfillment of their\nadvertising \u201csupply\u201d and ultimately, get the highest prices for their ads.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SSPs are software platforms that function\nsimilarly to their counterpart, the demand-side platforms (DSPs) advertisers\nuse to buy digital advertising programmatically.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">However, SSPs are designed\nspecifically to help publishers sell ad impressions \u2014 mobile, video, display\nand so on \u2014 at maximum CPMs (cost-per-thousand impressions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">What happens next is murky: once in their\nhands, the ad exchange or supply-side partner can mislead ad buyers into what\nmedia and publishers they sell and represent by rewriting the domain name.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">And\ndemand-side platforms (DSPs) can\u2019t tell if a domain name has been rewritten\nonce it\u2019s passed to them. While supply-side partners could help to filter out\nbogus traffic sent by ad exchanges, getting them to take action against\nfraudulent sellers is difficult.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SSPs profit by buying inventory at low prices\nand then reselling them for more.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Demand-side platforms (DSPs) are a fixture in\nthe programmatic ad buying landscape. They\u2019re a platform that manages multiple\nad exchanges through a single interface to facilitate the buying and selling of\ndigital ad inventory\u2014in the mobile marketing world, this inventory lives inside\napps.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As opposed to traditional ad networks, DSPs exist to automate the mobile\nad-buying process, and they do so while often yielding strong results for\nadvertisers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The process that DSPs use to buy ad space is\ncalled real-time bidding (RTB). App publishers make their ad inventory\navailable on ad exchanges via supply-side platforms (SSPs), and through the RTB\nprocess, DSPs set prices and bid on ad space as soon as it becomes available.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In literally milliseconds, DSPs process requests for ad space, choose the best\nimpression, bid on it, and then the ad is served in an app. This is what sets\nDSPs apart from traditional ad buying.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the past, ad buying involved a number\nof people and a longer manual process in order to place an ad. Now with\nprogrammatic technology, it takes less than a tenth of a second for a DSP to\ndetermine the value of an impression to a specific advertiser based on their\ntargeting parameters and secure the ad space.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With programmatic, targeting (and\nretargeting) is more focused. DSPs can target based on several different\nanonymized factors\u2014demographics, geography, the type of device being used, and\nbrowsing behavior, to name a select few.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DSPs also tend to have more advanced\nperformance tracking capabilities that are not possible through traditional ad\nnetworks, allowing advertisers to optimize their ad spend more efficiently.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DSPs offer advertisers a way to automate\npurchases over a huge selection of publishers\u2019 ad inventory. Highly focused\ntargeting combined with the performance tracking capabilities that DSPs offer\nmeans advertisers have better control over the quality of the inventory they\u2019re\nbuying. They\u2019re just a small part of the programmatic ecosystem that\u2019s paving\nthe way for better, higher-performing ad technology.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With fraud prevention such a major issue for\nthe advertising sector, a logical first place to look for value in blockchain\ntechnology is its ability to deliver higher levels of transparency and\nsecurity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The object here is to mitigate scenarios where customer and ad agency\nrelationships become seriously compromised due to these issues. The adChain\nprotocol works across all digital advertising channels, enabling participants\nacross the supply chain, from advertisers to demand-side platforms (DSP),\npublishers and safety vendors, to create a synchronized, fluid ecosystem free\nof fraud, bot traffic and malware.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">One of the clearest signs that your DSP is\nfake is the absence of a self-service user interface (UI). Without the ability\nto log into your DSP and examine the performance of your campaigns, you are\nflying completely blind.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Real DSP companies that have their own technology\nalmost always have an application programming interface, or API, which can be\nused by advertisers to create and control campaigns and pull reports. Real DSPs\nare never built on the API of another DSP.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">On the other hand, fake DSPs are either\nmanually operating a DSP behind the scenes with people, or they have a basic\ninterface built on the API of an actual DSP. In either case, companies that are\nposing as DSPs cannot offer you the ability to access their API because they\ndon\u2019t have one. The only API available is from their underlying DSP provider.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In computer programming, an application\nprogramming interface (API) is a set of subroutine definitions, protocols, and\ntools for building application software. In general terms, it is a set of\nclearly defined methods of communication between various software components.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An application program interface (API) is code that allows two software\nprograms to communicate with each other. The API defines the correct way for a\ndeveloper to write a program that requests services from an operating system\n(OS) or other application.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There&nbsp;\nare decentralized advertising platforms built on blockchain technology--\nhighly scalable decentralized ecosystem for digital advertising which radically\nimproves programmatic advertising stack to provide efficient, transparent and\nmutually beneficial environment for users, publishers, advertisers and\ndecentralized applications (DApp) developers using blockchain\narchitecture.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Consider the way the\nprogrammatic advertising ecosystem currently works. Data management platforms\n(DMPs) collect and store all the users\u2019 data on central databases.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Demand side\nplatforms (DSPs) use this data and work with marketers/advertisers and help\nthem access ad spaces, while supply side platforms (SSPs) enable publishers to\nsell their ad spaces. These transactions are enabled by multiple ad exchanges\n(AppNexus, Microsoft Ad Exchange for instance) and ad networks (AdSense,\nClicksor, AdWords to name a few).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The blockchain ecosystem runs with the help\nof dApps (Decentralized Apps).&nbsp; They will\ncreate decentralized protocols on how the ecosystem should function on the\nEthereum blockchain.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Using these protocols developers will be able to build any\nkind of dApps (which will be bound by smart contracts based on the\naforementioned decentralized protocols) with integrated advertising\nmonetization economies for use within the ecosystem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/N3sFJVkMfM0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/N3sFJVkMfM0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Digital Marketing works with the help of\nthree mediums:--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Ad networks<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Demand-side platforms (DSP)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Supply-side platforms (SSP)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Ad networks link different publishers and\ncreate a pool where the DSPs and SSPs connect each other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A demand-side platform (DSP) is a system that\nallows buyers of digital advertising inventory to manage multiple ad exchange\nand data exchange accounts through one interface.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Demand-side platforms &nbsp;are\nprograms that let advertisers keep track of and manage all their different\naccounts in one place<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In technical terms, a data management\nplatform (DMP) is a centralized platform that aggregates first- and third-party\naudience data from your cross-channel marketing efforts.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A data management platform (DMP) collects data from a range of\nonline and offline sources, segments data into audiences, and uses those\naudience segments for a range of different activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A DMP is a database. But it's definitely not\nthe same as a marketing database. In the simplest terms, a marketing database\nis traditionally used to store data and intelligence about your most important\nasset \u2013 your customer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DMP is the fact that it collects, and\ncollates&nbsp; and stores much more\ninformation in real time. This information is geared towards helping marketers\nbuild audiences.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Audience data is collected from many sources including data\nfrom the marketing database, websites, 3rd party sources, and so on. This data\nis ingested and aggregated to form targetable segments/audiences for delivering\nthe most relevant messages and offers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The DMP is used to store anonymous\naudience-level data. It helps marketers and advertisers to analyze customer\ndata to better target offers, messages, and personalization.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">However, the DMP\ndoes not perform any type of online ad buying. This is the role of the Demand\nSide Platform (DSP). The DSP is responsible for the ad purchasing through its\nintegration with multiple ad exchanges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">However, it is important to note that DMPs\nhave integrations into leading DSPs and ad exchanges. This integration provides\nincredible acceleration for the marketer who is looking to connect audiences\nwith the fullest breadth of possible advertising reach.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But the DMP is not\nlimited to channeling it\u2019s targeting to just a single DSP.&nbsp; &nbsp;DMPs benefit from\nconnectivity into multiple DSP solutions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A DMP is not just\nlimited to targeting customers via online media. A strong DMP strategy\nactivates the audiences across many channels including websites, call centers,\nmobile apps, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A data management platform (DMP) is a\npowerful, centralized data warehouse that brings together information from all\nadvertising channels, platforms and touchpoints.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The idea behind DMPs is to\nhelp marketers aggregate diverse kinds of data coming from a variety of sources\nunder one roof and gain a 360-degree view of their consumers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With the help of DMPs, advertisers store\nessential customer data, tap into new audience segments and extract knowledge\nto target prospective audiences, optimize media buying processes, and create\nads that resonate with the public.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">DMPs are seamlessly integrated with\ndemand-side platforms (DSPs), supply-side platforms (SSPs) and ad exchanges to\ngive publishers and media buyers complete control over ad distribution and\naudience definition.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This means that if you have a data management platform,\nit\u2019s better to use it in compliance with other ad tech solutions so your data\nis activated right away.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The problem of overspending advertisers and\nunderpaid publishers can be solved by replacing the DMPs with a Blockchain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There's much more than advanced advertising\nembedded in the march of blockchain technology into the cable and media business<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain can be &nbsp;used throughout the emerging digital\nlandscape, in applications that include \"Content and Experience,\"\n\"Management,\" \"Data,\" \"Advertising and\nPromotion,\" \"Commerce and Sales,\" and \"Social and Relationship.\"\nIts marketing landscape chart identifies an array of emerging companies\noperating in each sector.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain &nbsp;can be used across the advertising ecosystem\n-- agencies, marketers and publishers -- to track ad impressions without\nrelying on one single entity\u2019s data \u2013 it can reduce fraud and costs in the\nadvertising supply chain<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain could &nbsp;make it easier for newsrooms to solicit and\nreceive sensitive information from whistleblowers ... and guarantee the\nauthenticity of sources, images and videos.&nbsp;\nIn the future, there could be a public ledger for news, a network system\nthat would exchange authentic news and parse out fake news,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Blockchain technology has the potential to\ntransform media as the internet did . Today main stream media is getting raped\nby social media</span></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain's decentralized technology can\nhelp resolve the contractual challenges of data sharing, including digital\nrights management, conditional access and privacy.&nbsp; &nbsp;Its features include\nidentification, proof (including timestamps) of activities, traceability and\nsecurity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain has the ability to keep data safe\nfor consumers and enterprises as a core appeal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Much of the initial focus has been on supply\nchain management and ways to streamline the complex network that involves\nproducers, brokers, distributors, processors and retailers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Main stream media companies will DIE if they\ndo NOT adapt to blockchain technology..&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain can resolve a lot of issues that bedevil the media and ad\nindustries, including fraud<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-l9Ve2iQHorM/We-rwnOWLfI/AAAAAAABWU4/xcr8vOxOIPwBQ52hERuraRmUZzo5z6JigCLcBGAs/s1600/all-about-programmatic-buyinghrtb-dspssp-dmp-dct-a-complete-digital-advertising-world-6-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"360\" data-original-width=\"638\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-l9Ve2iQHorM/We-rwnOWLfI/AAAAAAABWU4/xcr8vOxOIPwBQ52hERuraRmUZzo5z6JigCLcBGAs/s640/all-about-programmatic-buyinghrtb-dspssp-dmp-dct-a-complete-digital-advertising-world-6-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Reserve Bank of India describes the Hundi\nas \"an unconditional order in writing made by a person directing another\nto pay a certain sum of money to a person named in the order.\" The\noperation of the Hundi system has many parallels with the Hawala system<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The hundi made it possible for a OPIUM dealer\nfrom Malwa to sell in Kolkata without taking cash and risk being waylaid during\ntransit. He could, instead, have the buyer draw a hundi of equivalent amount in\nhis favour and present it to the latter\u2019s agent or drawee at Malwa, who would\nmake the payment in cash. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Alternatively, the seller could transfer the\nhundi through endorsement to a lender, who would extend the loan at a discount\nto its value. The same hundi was, then, encashed at par by the lender.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The hundi, in other words, served both as a\ncashless remittance facility enabling long-distance inland trade and also a\nsource of mobile credit, by virtue of it being freely transferable through\nsuccessive endorsements before being finally presented to the drawee. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It was the lubricant that greased the wheels\nof commerce, by connecting some 1,700 nationwide produce mandis and 12 nodal\nmoney markets handling the bulk of discounting of these bills<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">130 years ago a dozen Opium drug running\nagents of Sassoon&nbsp; introduced FATKA&nbsp; or futures trading in Opium that registered\nmeteoric growth at the baras (informal exchanges) of Kolkata\u2019s Burrabazar\nmarket.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Today they substitute the word JUTE for\nOPIUM.&nbsp; You can hardly make a fortune\nwith bullshit jute.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Bongs remember Keshram Poddar who used to\nlive in a modest apartment in Kolkata's Burrabazar neighbourhood.&nbsp;&nbsp; The founder of the Tarachand Ghanshyamdas\nfirm was Bhagwati Poddar.&nbsp; His son was\nTarachandand his great grandson was Ghanshyamdas Poddar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Their Marwari Parta system of daily\ncash-based accounting, enabled them to keep close tabs on business trends which\neven today's sophisticated ERP systems may not be able to match.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Almost 93% of the channel in Kolkata\ncomprises Marwari and Jain crypto Jew businessmen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THIS IS THE REASON WHY EVEN TODAY MORE\nTHAN&nbsp; 93% OF SHELL COMPANIES ARE EMBEDDED\nIN CALCUTTA WITH AN ARMY OF IMPOVERISHED BONG ACCOUNTANTS AND LAWYERS ( MOST\nFAKE ) SERVICING THEM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">TO CRACK THE CALCUTTA SHELL COMPANY RIDDLE,\nMODI MUST ASK FOR RETIRED BONG ACCOUNTANT LAWYER WHISTLE BLOWERS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THEY HAVE NO LOVE LOST FOR THEIR PAST MASTERS\nWHO TREATED THEM LIKE SHIT AND GAVE THEM A PITTANCE AS WAGES.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THEY HAVE AN AXE TO GRIND !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Ledgers have been used for centuries to\nrecord transactions, and they are just that, a record of a transaction. In\nfact, before Western banking as we know it existed, many parts of the world\nused (and to this day, continue to use) an informal funds transfer system known\nas Hawala . It is a very simple system based on ledger and trust! <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For example, sender A wishes to transfer\nfunds to receiver B (usually in another distant location). Sender A approaches\na Hawala dealer C and provides the funds. Hawala dealer C contacts Hawala\ndealer D who agrees to release funds to receiver B. Hawala dealers C and D have\na ledger to track all of the transactions and eventually settle-up at an\nappropriate time.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While cash is provided, no money is actually physically\ntransferred. Again, in this scenario, the \u2018double-spending problem\u2019 is avoided,\nbut perhaps not so in the digital realm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hawala is a money transfer system widely used\nin Arab countries and South Asia. The money is paid to an agent who instructs\nan associate in the relevant country to pay it to the final recipient. In\nhawala transactions, money enters the hawala system in local currency and\nleaves as foreign currency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hawala is the undocumented transfer of money.\nMost of the hawala done now is based on net-off basis. It is all about not\ngetting the money in the documented field, so that taxation or source of\nfunding is not questioned.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To put it simply, it is illegal/informal\ntransfer of money without moving it physically, leaving no traces or evidences.\nSince no official records are maintained, the source of the money cannot be traced.\nNo requirement of any id proof and disclosure of source of income is there..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;The\ncommission rates for transferring money through hawala are quite low.. Most of\nthe time illiterate Indian labourers in Dubai know of no other way\u2014they are\nscared. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">They have one day Friday off, when the banks\nhave a holiday. What can they do? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The unique feature of the system is that no\npromissory instruments are exchanged between the hawala brokers; the\ntransaction takes place entirely on the honour system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The total hawala transfers worldwide at about\n$150 billion per year.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hawala brokers who are taking part in a\ntransaction sit distant apart. They usually communicate through mobile phone or\nsatellite phone or email and most of the transactions happen without meeting\nthe other person.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Let\u2019s say Mr A in Abu Dhabi wants to transfer\n1 lakh riyal to his brother say Mr B in Karachi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now A contacts X, who is a hawaladar in Abu\nDhabi and gives him 1 lakh riyal and also a password.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now X contacts Y, another Hawaladar (his\ncounterpart) in Karachi and asks him to pay 1 lakh riyal (in local currency in\nthis case Rupees) after deducting the commission which is usually 2%.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">B would be informed by A about the the\npassword.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now B will contact Y, tells the password and\ncollects the money (2% commission is deducted)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now X owes Y money which is settled later.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hawala agents or brokers run some business\nother than the hawala agency. So they have surplus of liquid money in hand to\ncarry out the transactions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The demonetisation drive in India has forced\nhawala operators to find new ways to turn black money into white, especially in\nthe Gulf region.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The modus operandi: An NRI gives 3,500\ndirhams to a hawala agent. The former gets Rs 1.5 lakh in India, albeit in the\nscrapped Rs 500 and Rs 1,000 notes. The present exchange rate of 3500 dirhams\nis around Rs 64,000, doubling the profit. As the amount is below Rs 2.5 lakh,\nno queries will be made while depositing the amount.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This money uses the 'hawala' route, an\ninformal money transfer system, where rupee gets converted to dollar at a\npremium to market exchange rates. In the process, Indian black money is\ninvested in Dubai property. And since Dubai charges no tax on rental income or\nany capital gains for purchased property, cash-rich Indians know their\ninvestments are safe.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As hawala transactions are not routed through\nbanks they cannot be regulated by the government agencies and have thus emerged\nas a major cause of concern. This network is being used extensively across the\nglobe to circulate black money and to provide funds for terrorism, drug\ntrafficking and other illegal activities.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The idea of a ledger is a good one since it\ntracks all of the transactions and keeps a record. But in the digital realm,\nwho is in charge of the ledger? Might they alter the ledger or create false\ntransactions or duplicate digital notes? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While the Hawala system and ledger is based\non trust and shared between a small number of people, blockchain provides a\nledger visible to Patents any number of people and replaces trust with \u2018proof\nof work\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A blockchain is formed by a number of blocks\nlinked together to form a chain. Each block in the chain represents transaction\ndata and blocks are arranged in a linear sequence over time, forming a\nblockchain. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Any new blocks that are appended to the chain\ncannot be changed or removed. Users of the system update and check the\nintegrity of the ledger by participating. The process of adding a new block to\nthe blockchain involves hard work (in terms of computing power, and in turn,\nelectricity) by solving a cryptographic proof, a hash function. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Only once this \u2018proof of work\u2019 is completed\ncan a block be added to the end of the chain and get the approval of other\npeople in the network. This \u2018proof of work\u2019 concept ensures the integrity of\nthe ledger. So imagine you have total faith in the integrity of a ledger, you\ncan see how there may be other applications beyond cryptocurrencies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Consequently, we are now seeing a swathe of\ninnovations in this space. For example, digital notaries that require no\nthird-party verification, management of financial contracts and wills, e-voting\nand cloud storage applications to name but a few. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain technology will change the way we\ncarry out day-to-day transactions in the future, in ways we are yet to imagine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Short for decentralized autonomous\norganization, a DAO is software designed to manage the fiduciary obligations of\nholding and disbursing blockchain assets without any human involvement. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The code that was developed for the\n(confusingly named) \u201cThe DAO\u201d application was called a \u201csmart contract,\u201d and\nran as a DAO application on top of the Ethereum blockchain. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The original vision of the Ethereum creators\nwas that computer code should, quite literally, be treated as law in their\ncommunity and serve as replacement for legal agreements and regulation. \u201cThe\nDAO\u201d creators embraced this vision and noted that participants should look\nexclusively to the application\u2019s code as dispositive on all matters. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The code was the contract and the law for The\nDAO. Unfortunately, The DAO\u2019s smart contract was flawed: It allowed a DAO token\nholder who exploited a bug in the code to siphon off one-third of the value\nheld in the application (roughly $50 million) to their own account. in 2016, a\nvulnerability in the DAO smart contract allowed hackers to steal $74 mln from\n11,000 individuals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The people who created the DAO saw it as a\ndecentralized investment fund. Instead of leaving decisions to a few partners,\nanyone who invested would have a say in which companies to fund. The more you\ncontributed, the more weight your vote carried. And the distributed structure\nmeant no one could run off with the money.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">That was the plan, anyway.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The DAO is built on Ethereum, a system\ndesigned for building decentralized applications. Its creators hoped to prove\nyou can build a more democratic financial institution, one without centralized\ncontrol or human fallibility. Instead, the DAO led to a heist that raises\nphilosophical questions about the viability of such systems. Code was supposed\nto eliminate the need to trust humans. But humans, it turns out, are tough to\ntake out of the equation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Code is law for machines, law is code for\npeople. When we mix up these concepts, we wind up with situations like \u201cThe\nDAO.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Let's say you have $50 in the bank and you\nwant to withdraw that from an ATM. You insert your card, punch in your PIN\nnumber and then request that $50. Before the machine spits out the cash it will\ncheck your balance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;Once\nit spits out the cash, it will debit $50 from that balance. Then the machine\nasks you if you'd like to process another transaction. You tap \"yes\"\nand try to take $50 again. But the ATM sees that your balance is now $0 and\nrefuses. It asks you again if you want to process another transaction, so this\ntime you say \"no.\" Your session ends.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now imagine that the ATM didn't record your new\nbalance until you ended the session. You could keep requesting $50 again and\nagain until you finally told the machine you didn't want to process any more\ntransactions\u2014or the machine ran out of money.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The DAO hacker was probably able to run a\ntransaction that automatically repeated itself over and over again before the\nsystem checked the balance<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The attacker withdrew Ether from The DAO\nsmart contract multiple times using the same DAO Tokens. This was possible due\nto what is known as a recursive call exploit.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In this exploit, the attacker was\nable to \"ask\" the smart contract (DAO) to give the Ether back\nmultiple times before the smart contract could update its own balance.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0eoMThcOX5k/WfBjfW4tcsI/AAAAAAABWVM/MyXeZBaRlFokYtZ_yTjef9jwaOEAwhG4gCLcBGAs/s1600/eth-prJice-plumets-da-hacked.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"624\" data-original-width=\"859\" height=\"464\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0eoMThcOX5k/WfBjfW4tcsI/AAAAAAABWVM/MyXeZBaRlFokYtZ_yTjef9jwaOEAwhG4gCLcBGAs/s640/eth-prJice-plumets-da-hacked.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
