Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "223", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/8872886824162180424/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "8885069140437430668", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-10-18T07:10:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-10-20T00:19:59+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNTA4NDM4OTk5NjkwCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/10/blockchain-smart-contracts-part-3-capt.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/8885069140437430668", "title": "BLOCKCHAIN, SMART CONTRACTS , PART 3 -  CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 2 , BELOW---</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/10/blockchain-smart-contracts-part-2-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">&nbsp;http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/10/blockchain-smart-contracts-part-2-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It\u2019s in everyone\u2019s interest to speed the time\nbetween transaction and payment.&nbsp;\nBlockchain will drive settlement time down to T-1 or even T-0 <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain can help eliminate the need for\ninter-bank netting agreements, as \u201cpromises to pay\u201d can be replaced with actual\npayments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">T+1, T+2 and T+3, as well as other\n\"T+\" numbers, refers to the number of days it takes to settle a\nfinancial transaction. occurs the same business day the trade occurs (this is\ncalled \"T+0\")<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Whenever you buy or sell a stock, bond, or\nmutual fund, there are two important dates of which you should always be aware:\nthe transaction date and the settlement date.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The abbreviations T+1, T+2, and\nT+3 refer to the settlement dates of security transactions which occur on a transaction\ndate plus one day, plus two days, and plus three days, respectively. 'T' is the\ntransaction date.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Some years ago, the settlement date for\nstocks was T+5, or five business days after the transaction date. Today it's\nT+3 i.e. three business days after the transaction date.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Prior to the mass adoption of smart\ncontracts, their legal status needs to be assessed in order to choose the\nappropriate smart contract model suitable for a particular jurisdiction.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\">To put\nit simply, code is not law, but smart contracts created on a platform enabling\nthe execution of said contracts and dispute resolution may be one.</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>IN FUTURE LAWYERS MUST BE BLOCKCHAIN , SMART\nCONTRACT SAVVY<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>SUCH LAWYERS WILL BE HIGHLY PAID <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">SUCH LAWYERS CANNOT BE THE BOTTOM FUCKIN' DREGS OF\nTHE SCHOOL CEREBRAL BARREL.</b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">OUR IITs MUST NOW HAVE A ELITE COMPUTER SCIENCE DEPT FOR&nbsp; &nbsp;\"SMART CONTRACT PROGRAMMERS \" .&nbsp; &nbsp; THE INDIAN BRAIN IS BEST SUITED FOR THIS JOB.</b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-aPxhUvbfz2A/Wedq0hfexDI/AAAAAAABWQo/a5Q_4IIsIt8QWg_PtJRWeCgjp3tq0NMEgCLcBGAs/s1600/downsload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: large;\"><b>Before jumping off the deep end-- make sure there are NO sharkULUs! ( or is it sharkUDUs?) !</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"https://yourstory.com/2017/10/fintech-valley-vizag-blockchain-ap-govt/\">https://yourstory.com/2017/10/fintech-valley-vizag-blockchain-ap-govt/</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://www.ibtimes.co.in/demystifying-blockchain-india-begins-fintech-valley-vizag-745002\">http://www.ibtimes.co.in/demystifying-blockchain-india-begins-fintech-valley-vizag-745002</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"https://telecomtalk.info/fintech-valley-vizag-bringing-a-revolution-in-terms-of-financial-technology/168888/\">https://telecomtalk.info/fintech-valley-vizag-bringing-a-revolution-in-terms-of-financial-technology/168888/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-5YhipBYuH0M/WedrGLq4nOI/AAAAAAABWQs/Mpm6q0tN8RAky4pcKD1O1uJqJAVmun3xACLcBGAs/s1600/If-youre-ngoing-to-jump-in-the-deep-end-Kent-Healy.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"573\" data-original-width=\"717\" height=\"508\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-5YhipBYuH0M/WedrGLq4nOI/AAAAAAABWQs/Mpm6q0tN8RAky4pcKD1O1uJqJAVmun3xACLcBGAs/s640/If-youre-ngoing-to-jump-in-the-deep-end-Kent-Healy.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain Business Conference, was&nbsp; organised by Fintech Valley Vizag&nbsp; from 9th \u2013 10th October 2017 in Vizag<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Indeed the Blockchain revolution has just\nbegun. .&nbsp;&nbsp; An important part of this\nprocess is an exchange of ideas between the bright minds.&nbsp;&nbsp; Since the concept of Blockchain came into\nlight, everybody is trying to find its use in different industries.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Some countries are more inclined towards\nworking to implement it in Banking, some in supply-chain and so on.&nbsp; We all can learn from each other\u2019s\napproach.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In India we have a crying need to speed up\nthe Judicial system (<b style=\"background-color: white;\"> run by bottom dregs of the school cerebral barrel </b>)&nbsp; and to map real estate .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/undertrial-prisoners-in-indian-remand.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/undertrial-prisoners-in-indian-remand.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">We had commies and church &nbsp;grabbing all lands in India<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Read all 8 parts below\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/communist-maoist-naxalite-movements-in.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/communist-maoist-naxalite-movements-in.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain is not exactly a silver bullet\nthat will fix everything wrong with the internet. Nevertheless it is a powerful\ntool that will help cyber security experts in stemming the oncoming onslaught\nof cyber attacks. It will also be a tool which will help them leverage their\nsystems to be prepared for any attack of this manner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In blockchain, a digital key is needed for\neach user to execute exchanges or transactions, but generally speaking, if the\nkey is lost, it becomes impossible to transfer monetary funds. One notable\nissue is that if a key is stolen, all of the funds in an account can be stolen<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hardware Security Module (HSM). are\ncrypto-processors that securely generate, protect and store digital\nkeys\u2014cryptographic material that provide security and access to\ndigitally-stored information. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">HSM is a physical device that provides extra\nsecurity for sensitive data. This type of device is used to provision\ncryptographic keys for critical functions such as encryption, decryption and\nauthentication for the use of applications, identities and databases. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For example, businesses may use an HSM to\nsecure trade secrets that have significant value by ensuring only authorized\nindividuals can access the HSM to complete a cryptography key transaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A hardware security module (HSM) is a\nphysical computing device that safeguards and manages digital keys for strong\nauthentication and provides cryptoprocessing. These modules traditionally come\nin the form of a plug-in card or an external device that attaches directly to a\ncomputer or network server.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">HSMs, are dedicated cryptographic devices\nthat are securely and compliantly perform all the cryptographic operations on a\nnetwork, including key management.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">They are logically partitioned on a network\nin a way that prevents risk to virtual attacks, and they adhere to government\nregulated physical security standards that deter physical theft. Before large\nenterprise organizations begin to adopt blockchain technology, they will first\nneed HSMs and key management solutions that are flexible and scalable enough to\nbe integrated into a blockchain environment<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While blockchain technology itself has proved\ntamper-resistant, cryptographic keys are essential to secure access to a\ndistributed network and ensure transactions are valid.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These keys can become\nvulnerable and stolen via network breaches, as seen in the attacks on\ncryptocurrency exchanges in recent years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Underpinning each blockchain is robust\ncryptography used to protect the data from fraud perpetrated by hackers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As with any crypto-based infrastructure,\nprotecting keys is paramount to ensuring a blockchain system\u2019s security.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A successful blockchain system needs highly\nreliable methods of interfacing with the strong key protection practices\nafforded by HSMs, and these HSMs must deliver the scaling and flexibility a\ndecentralized blockchain model needs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain and distributed ledger technology\n(DLT) applications combine the message and the asset in a single token. Once an\nasset is embedded into a blockchain or distributed ledger, possessing the\nassociated cryptographic keys is the only way to retrieve or move the asset. In\nother words, the key becomes the asset. (By contrast, in a traditional IT\nmodel, a key protects the database, which in turn protects the data or the\nasset.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">When the key and the asset are one and the\nsame, anyone who obtains the key can monetize and exploit the asset instantly.\nAs we\u2019ve seen in security breaches in public blockchain settings,-- the\nmalicious transfer of \u2018value\u2019 can be instantaneous, irreversible, and\nsignificant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These attacks exploited vulnerabilities at\nthe application layer\u2014the wallets holding the keys to the assets\u2014rather than\nthe underlying blockchain &nbsp;protocol.&nbsp;&nbsp; So far, blockchain technology itself has proved\ntamper-resistant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The ability to edit a distributed database\nbroadens the technology\u2019s applicability. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It allows data within a block to be edited or\nremoved under strict protocols in permissioned systems, leaving a scar as\nevidence of the edit. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While the\nredaction capability broadens blockchain\u2019s applicability, it also makes the protection\nof the keys that must come together to \u201cunlock\u201d and relock the chain\nmission-critical.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">HSMs can be clustered for greater performance\nand availability, allowing encryption functions to scale without sacrificing\nsecurity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">By relieving servers from performing processor-intensive\ncalculations, HSMs increase operational efficiency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Moving the cryptographic functions from\nsoftware to dedicated hardware devices reduces the risk of processor errors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The keys stored in the architecture cannot be\nextracted and used except under a highly controlled protocol, making it\npossible to keep track of who has access to keys.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To mount a successful attack, attackers\neither need to have administrative privileges, access to data before it is\nencrypted, or physical access to the HSM(s).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Attackers would need to possess a quorum of\ncards and their associated pass phrases in order to access the Control and\nInfrastructure keys.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It is better to have a&nbsp; HSM Rather than a software solution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">All keys are stored securely inside an HSM\ndevice.&nbsp; Once keys are created and stored\nin an HSM architecture, they are essentially impossible for &nbsp;nauthorized users to extract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">We must ensure that the data belonging to\ncompanies and government entities is both secure and trusted in any environment\n\u2013 on-premise, in the cloud, in data centers or big data environments \u2013 without sacrificing\nbusiness agility<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Security of a blockchain depends upon the\nsecurity of its cryptographic keys. Every transaction executed through a\nblockchain process requires a new set of one-time keys. HSM&nbsp; generates and secures these critical keys. We\nmust run security-critical code protected within the HSM boundary.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Integrating with existing systems,\ncryptographic key material management,&nbsp;\nand providing the required network quality of service connecting\nblockchain members are the greatest cyber-security concerns . Any organization\napplying blockchain technology to an existing process almost certainly has\nexisting systems that chaincode/smart contracts will have to interact\nwith.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It is never prudent to underestimate the\nability of a hacker. One hacker or a small group of hackers can shut down an entire\nsystem, lure the unwary into cyber traps, steal millions worth in data and even\ntopple down governments by leaking classified information online.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchains alternative approach to storing\nand sharing information provides a way out of this security mess.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Most cryptocurrencies are backed up by public\nblockchains, which are widely available and accessible to anyone on the P2P\nnetwork who wishes to participate in \u201cmining\u201d on the blockchain. While the wide\navailability contributes to mass collaboration and trust, it can also lead to\nquestions about cryptographic integrity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Many nodes on public blockchains store\nand generate keys from software-based programs servers and standard hard\ndrives. This is a much less than desirable method of key storage that leaves\nencryption keys vulnerable to both physical and virtual theft.&nbsp;&nbsp; Encrypted data is only as secure as the keys\nused for the encryption. Once keys are compromised, so is the data.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There is a document encryption technology,\nwhich allows only relevant parties who hold multiple distributed keys to\nsecurely access the information recorded in the blockchain.. With document\nencryption technology, it is also possible to create a workflow where documents\nare acknowledged by collective decision making or between specified\norganizations, or where they can be restored when keys are lost.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There exists&nbsp;\ntechnology that can restrict transactions based on pre-established\npolicies, such as restricting users to specific stores when executing\ntransactions such as sending money. The technology provides a new framework\nthat ties policies to keys used in activities such as capital transfers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\ntechnology ensures that initiated transactions which violate policy\nrequirements are prohibited from getting added to the blockchain as a result of\nverification failures at multiple computers participating in the blockchain.\nThis makes it possible to limit damage even if a key were to be stolen<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Storing documents in blockchain can guarantee\nthat the original state of the document will be preserved, but because the\ncontent is public to blockchain users, this method is not appropriate to store\ndocuments which contain confidential information.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">By applying a secret sharing-based key\nmanagement system to document encryption, where different portions of a key are\nheld by multiple users ( Mr. A and Mr. B), and once a specified number of\npieces have been gathered, a key can be generated.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There exists&nbsp; blockchain document encryption technology\nwhich can control who can read the contract documents, where the confidential\nportions of the contracts will not be visible to ordinary users (Mr. C), and\nenabling document anonymity control. It can only be read when the parties\ninvolved, who hold portions of the key, work together.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With transaction restriction technology, it\nis now possible to prevent the misuse or abuse of keys based on preset policies\nfor secure blockchain operations. In addition, blockchain-based document\nencryption technology through secret sharing-based key management makes it\npossible to collaborate to find solutions to lost keys, or to create a workflow\nthat requires acknowledgement from multiple managers when making collective\ndecisions involving large transaction amounts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">1. Protecting identities: Public Key\nInfrastructure (PKI) is a form of public key cryptography that secures emails,\nmessaging apps, websites and other forms of communication. But PKI relies on\nthird-party Certificate Authorities (CA) to issue, revoke and store key pieces\nof information. Information that can be duplicated by hackers who can spoof\nidentities that can get them through an encrypted system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp; 2.\nProtecting data integrity: Blockchain replaces secrets with transparency, distributing\nevidence across many blockchain nodes making it practically impossible to\nmanipulate data without being caught.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">3. Protecting critical infrastructure: The\nmassive ransomware attack of May 2017 is a painful reminder of easy it has\nbecome for hackers to hold an entire infrastructure hostage. A blockchain\napproach to storing DNS entries could, improve security by removing the single\ntarget that hackers can attack to compromise the entire system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A transparent, distributed DNS where domain\nrecords are under their owners control will also make it virtually impossible\nfor any single entity, including governments, to manipulate entries at their\nwhim.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If the central banks involved in the\nBangladesh bank heist had been using blockchain, the money might still have\nbeen stolen but it would be easier to trace and, therefore, recover.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;The\nmoney stolen from the Bangladesh central bank went to banks.&nbsp; Even if commercial banks as well as central\nbanks used a blockchain-based system, tracing payments would come to an abrupt\nend once the money was converted to physical cash.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Banknotes and coins are\ncompletely anonymous. The trail goes dry at the bank teller\u2019s counter, and that\nis why hidden cams must be placed there<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh_Bank_robbery\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh_Bank_robbery</a></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the Bangladesh heist, SWIFT messages were\nused to authorize money transfers. Would the fraudulent messages have been\neasier to spot if SWIFT had been using blockchain?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Bangladesh authorities argue that hackers\ngained access to the system without the knowledge or involvement of bank staff.\nBut SWIFT has strict security protocols, including use of a physical key, long\npasswords and biometric access control.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">International investigators believe it\nis more likely that the SWIFT messages were sent or authorized by someone\ninside the central bank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But the SWIFT messages were not \u201cobviously\nfraudulent.\u201d&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; They were correctly\nauthenticated. The problem is not the SWIFT system itself, but the access to\nit. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Bangladesh bank heist, the problem\nwas not that the payments processing service was insecure, but that access\nsecurity was compromised.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SWIFT announced findings from the\ninvestigation on 13 May 2016. It was found that attackers first exploited\nvulnerabilities in the bank's funds transfer initiation environments.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This may\nnot have been too challenging as the Bangladesh Bank were using \"cheap\nsecurity devices,\" and \"their firewalls were not functioning at full\ncapacity as they didn't have proper licences\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The attackers obtained valid operator\ncredentials that have the authority to create, approve, and submit SWIFT\nmessages from customers' back-offices or from their local interfaces to the\nSWIFT network.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Since this bypasses the primary risk controls that Bangladesh\nBank had in place, the attackers then submitted fraudulent messages by\nimpersonating the operators from whom they stole the credentials.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Finally, the attackers tampered with\nstatements and confirmations that the bank used as a secondary control, to hide\ntheir criminal activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial\nTelecommunication (SWIFT) provides a network that enables financial\ninstitutions worldwide to send and receive information about financial\ntransactions in a secure, standardized and reliable environment..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The majority\nof international interbank messages use the SWIFT network. As of 2015, SWIFT\nlinked more than 11,000 financial institutions in more than 200 countries and\nterritories, who were exchanging an average of over 15 million messages per day..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SWIFT transports financial messages in a highly secure way but does not hold\naccounts for its members and does not perform any form of clearing or\nsettlement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SWIFT does not facilitate funds transfer:\nrather, it sends payment orders, which must be settled by correspondent\naccounts that the institutions have with each other.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Each financial\ninstitution, to exchange banking transactions, must have a banking relationship\nby either being a bank or affiliating itself with one (or more) so as to enjoy\nthose particular business features. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\n$81 million theft from the Bangladesh central bank via its account at the New\nYork Federal Reserve Bank was traced to hacker penetration of SWIFT's Alliance\nAccess software<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SWIFT has dubbed its blockchain projects\nsuccessful, according to a report published a couple of day ago regarding its\nproof-of-concept with the technology. Specifically, the test dealt with funds\nin Nostro accounts, and sought to determine whether moving that money over to a\ndistributed ledger could allow those funds the freedom to be used in other\ninvestments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The long-simmering rivalry between Swift and\nRipple is nearing the boiling point. Ripple has openly criticized Swift several\ntimes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Ripple is a peer-to-peer protocol for\ncross-border payments, with no central hub. &nbsp;SWIFT gpi is with a hyperledger protocol (a\nclosed private blockchain), while Ripple with an interledger protocol\n(peer-to-peer with no central hub).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The blockchain-savvy newcomer Ripple offers a\nso-called Interledger Protocol for connecting payment networks and distributed\nledgers that financial institutions can use to send and settle international\npayments among one another.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Potentially, this would allow them to bypass the\ntraditional correspondent banking model in which a payment makes several hops\nacross a network of banks that have direct relationships. It\u2019s essentially an\nalternative to Swift, the incumbent and guardian of the correspondent banking\nmodel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Swift has also said it will support\nblockchain technology for certain use cases. On Tuesday, it announced a blockchain\nproof-of-concept for nostro reconciliation, where banks hold foreign currency\nin accounts at other banks to facilitate foreign exchange and trade\ntransactions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Banks still have to conduct anti-money-laundering,\nknow-your-customer, and Office of Foreign Asset Control checks on the Ripple\nplatform SWIFT now claims that they have successfully tested transacting in\nreal time use blockchain technology with 33 banks<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SWIFT is &nbsp;slow, expensive and old-fashioned.\nTransactions via the SWIFT network certainly cannot happen in real-time. An\ninternational transaction may take days to settle and the fees are more than 10\npercent of the total transaction costs. .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The recent surge in cyberattacks in\nBangladesh, Vietnam and Ecuador have highlighted the vulnerabilities in\ncross-border transaction banking, and particularly in the SWIFT network<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Ripple is looking to \"capitalise\"\non the recent cyberattacks on the SWIFT network by introducing a multi-sign\nfeature on its consensus ledger. This allows account holders to require\nsignatures by more than one stakeholder to authorise their transactions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">With\nmulti-sign, the user can require signatures from other users, devices, or\ninstitutions, making the life hard for malicious actors. Ripple is also\nplanning to offer a similar multi-sign capability over its Interledger Protocol\n(ILP). The new features found in distributed fintech solutions, such as\nmulti-signing, are not available in traditional systems like SWIFT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Ripple\u2019s GPSG may be the foundation of a\ncompletely modern payments network. It&nbsp;\ncould become a serious future alternative for the present SWIFT network,\nbeing the only blockchain bankers\u2019 network on&nbsp;\na global scale with defined rules and governance ..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SWIFT, being member\nof the Hyperledger Project just like Ripple, is now also looking to this\ntechnology and its possible applications. SWIFT should completely replace its\nexisting (though very old fashioned) system by a permissioned blockchain\nsystem. That would take a very long time and costs a lot of money.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Swift is the\nbackbone of the banking industry worldwide. Built in the 1970s to replace telex\nmachines with electronic transfers, Swift is a co-operatively funded network by\nthe global banking system to let them send funds with confidence .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Banks trade something like $5 trillion a day\nin currencies alone, and most of that is handled by message exchanges to and\nfrom the Swift network. Swift right now doesn't have the capability to connect\nto various smart contracts on various chains.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fraudulent wire transfers aren\u2019t always the\nwork of hackers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The nature of today\u2019s payment processing\nservices can make it difficult to follow the movements of money. U.S.4 In some\ncountries, secrecy rules prevent banks from revealing financial information\nabout their customers to foreign regulators.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Lenders have struggled for years with\noutdated and disparate technology. Last year, identity theft and fraud cost\nconsumers 17 billion USD. The threat of online fraud has spurred many credit\ncard companies and financial institutions to alert consumers when potentially\nfraudulent transactions are made. However, that hasn\u2019t stopped criminals from\nstealing identifying information and using it without permission.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Enter blockchain, promising \u201csecure,\ntamper-proof digital records.\u201d&nbsp;&nbsp; A\nblockchain is a complete and immutable record of asset transfers. When\nblockchain underpins a payments processing service, it\u2019s possible to trace the\nentire sequence of wire transfers..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Again, Blockchain is a shared ledger that is\ndecentralized and resistant to tampering. It allows verified contributors to\nstore, view and share digital information in a security-rich environment, which\nhelps to foster trust, accountability and transparency in business\nrelationships. With blockchain, information can be shared in real time, and the\nledger can only be updated when all parties agree.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This can reduce time, costs\nand opportunities to commit fraud<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If identifying information is placed on a\npermissioned blockchain framework, authorized parties will have access to one\nversion of the truth, and only known participants can verify transactions and\nensure records are valid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It\u2019s very difficult to manipulate the\nblockchain, which is an immutable record that can only be updated and validated\nthrough consensus among network participants. And if a product is digitized on\nblockchain, it can easily be traced back to its origin because the information\nis on shared, distributed ledger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">If the central banks involved in the\nBangladesh bank heist had been using blockchain, the money might still have\nbeen stolen but it would be easier to trace and, therefore, recover. Because\nblockchain documents all changes and is hard to tamper with, financial firms\nand regulators see it as a potential way to make transactions more transparent,\nauditable and secure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SWIFT shares technical information about\ncyber attacks and other details on how hackers target banks on a private portal\nopen to its members.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Banks and headhunters are trawling worldwide &nbsp;universities for talent and luring tech\nstart-up executives with 50 percent pay rises and salaries of up to 200,000\nUSD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">While blockchain networks are built on the\nnotion of decentralized control, the infrastructure can leave back doors open\nto vulnerabilities that allow tampering and unauthorized access. That is why it\nis so important for enterprises to use a blockchain designed for business, on\nthe right infrastructure and with the right services.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Have you ever been the victim of identity\ntheft? It is an ugly experience.&nbsp; Calling\nup credit card companies to change all your cards and dispute charges.&nbsp; Resetting passwords to all of your\napplications.&nbsp; Always worrying whether\nsomeone may call up your cell phone provider with your leaked information to\ncommit a SIM porting hack, meaning they would have access to all of your text\nmessages.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Our user names, passwords, and personal\ninformation are being stored on centralized corporate servers, many of which\nremain ripe for the picking, despite the attention on this class of problems\nover the last several years. Once your personally identifying information genie\nis loose, it's extraordinarily difficult to put it back in the bottle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A key feature of blockchain is that it\ndecentralizes system management and authorization to a network of computers.\nThose computers together verify transactions based on certain prespecified\nrules (controls) that have been embedded in the system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To avoid a single point\nof failure, the transaction verification process is controlled by all the\ncomputers, rather than managed centrally. The computers jointly supervise\nsystem operation and prevent the information in the ledger from being tampered\nwith.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Because of this feature, blockchain can effectively prevent one or\nseveral individuals in collusion from overriding controls, or illicitly\nchanging or deleting official accounting records.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Moreover, as the embedded\nrules are automatically followed without much human intervention, it can\nenforce the operation of controls. By incorporating blockchain technology to\ntheir accounting information systems and cyber security strategy, companies\ncould reduce cyber fraud risk by maintaining a clean, secure database and a\nstrengthened control system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain&nbsp;\nprevents accounting records or related electronic documents from being\naltered or deleted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Because data recorded on the blockchain is\ndifficult to alter and not under the control of a single party, use of the\nblockchain can aid in the preservation of records, evidence and institutional\nmemory. For example, one can imagine a future in which lost policy disputes are\nunheard of.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Once an insurance policy is sold and is written to the blockchain,\ncoverage could be verified in the future without relying on an insurance\ncompany to check its records. Insurance certificates also could become a thing\nof the past, along with litigation that arises out of the certificate issuance\nprocess.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Or imagine adding executable code to a\nblockchain-stored insurance policy that provides for automatic payment of\nclaims when certain events take place.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain could be used to prevent and\ndetect fraudulent transactions. Because blockchain keeps the record of an asset\ntransfer, any type of misappropriation can be detected by tracing through the\nblockchain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To combat financial reporting fraud, such as\noverstatement of revenues by means of channel stuffing or round-tripping, the\ntransactional data in blockchain could provide valid evidence showing any\npotential irregularities involving revenue recognition<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Mauritius had become the top source of FDI\ninto India only due to ROUND TRIPPING.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Mauritius had been the source of more than\n37%&nbsp; of all foreign direct investment\ninflows into India between 2000 and 2015.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">ROUND TRIPPING is a phenomenon by which\nIndian individuals and companies avoid tax by sending funds abroad and then\nbringing them back on to home soil via Mauritius-based companies. Much of the\ninvestment into India via Mauritius over the last 15 years is believed to have\nbeen by CORRUPT Indian residents\u2014all BIG FISH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;Signed\nin 1983, the Double Taxation Avoidance treaty between the two countries made\nMauritius, which taxes capital gains at near-zero rates, an attractive \u201cpost\nbox address\u201d for foreign investors to route investments into India&nbsp; Indians&nbsp;\nwho evaded taxes set up shell companies in Mauritius, concealing\nidentities and channeling cash or stock market investments through \u201cround\ntripping\u201d and \u201cparticipatory notes\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Securities and Exchange Board of India\n(Sebi)&nbsp; tightened the norms for\nparticipatory notes (P-notes) in order to check misuse of these instruments in\nround-tripping and money laundering.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A few months ago, India and Singapore&nbsp; signed a pact for amendment of the Double\nTaxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA), in a bid to curb illegal hoarding of money\nand&nbsp; to prevent round-tripping of funds,\nmisused for tax evasion. This was done for Mauritius and Cyprus earlier<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA)\nwas a major reason for a large number of foreign portfolio investors (FPI) and\nforeign entities to route their investments in India through Mauritius.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">A DTAA applies in cases where a tax-payer\nresides in one country and earns income in another.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The DTAA, or Double Taxation Avoidance\nAgreement is a tax treaty signed between India and another country ( or any\ntwo/multiple countries) so that taxpayers can avoid paying double taxes on\ntheir income earned from the source country as well as the residence country.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Within a blockchain, transactions are\nchronologically recorded in a local, digital ledger. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The ledger doesn\u2019t exist in just one place.\nInstead, copies exist with and are simultaneously updated with every fully\nparticipating entity in the ecosystem. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The most recent set of transactions is known\nas a block, and each block is hashed and linked with previous blocks.
