color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>ABOVE :&nbsp; MY TEAR TARLING&nbsp; &nbsp;--&nbsp; WHEN ARE WE ATTACKING CHINA ?</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\nBelow: In 1983 I bought my first computer --a Radio Shack TRS-80, PC2.&nbsp; &nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The PC-2 was a\ncompletely unique architecture and was the only unit in the line allowing\ndirect memory access with POKE, PEEK and CALL.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/NQheo52J3BM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/NQheo52J3BM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I learnt BASIC, ( Beginner\u2019s\nAll-purpose Symbolic Instruction Code ) , Computer programming language by\nmyself .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anybody with\ncommonsense would write a BASIC program. A background in mathematics or science\nis not required.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A program itself is\nmerely a series of commands in the order in which they are to be executed. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Programming languages allow people\nto give instructions to a computer with commands that both the computer and the\nprogrammer can understand. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I computerized my\nentire Captain\u2019s work\u2014Navigation, cargo work , accounts etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My container ship\nstowage programme was out of the world\u2014with inputs like TEU / FEU , stowage\nslot, ports of load/ unload, commodity, weight \u2013it could spit out any\ninformation I wanted\u2014every which way.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS IS THE MEANING OF USING A COMPUTER--&nbsp; YOU JUST FEED IN RAW DATA -&nbsp; THE PROGRAMMED COMPUTER&nbsp; LATER GIVES YOU EXACTLY WHAT YOU ASK FOR --&nbsp; NOT AN IOTA MORE --NOT AN IOTA LESS&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My computer could make\nsounds of varied Pitch/ Frequency/ Tone.&nbsp;\nI made a BEEP BEEP BEEP sound that resonated the body of a pregnant female\nmosquito ( which gave malaria ) or a daylight mosquito which gave dengue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SO I KNOW WHAT I AM\nTALKING ABOUT WHEN I SAY \u201cSMART PROGRAM \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When on the training\nship I was a morse code signaling champ. &nbsp;&nbsp;My computer could send morse code at varied\nspeeds . &nbsp;&nbsp;I was thrice faster in Morse code\nthan any Radio Officer who sailed with me . &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I could do nerve signaling transmission and\nthis marveled all radio officers ( up and own keys \u2013not the Russian side keys )\nas it was too fast for them to receive it<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I made smart programs &nbsp;to finger my officers wives\u2014 I would tell them\nwhen their menses is due ( based on the moon phase ) and they went WOW !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I dared anybody to beat\nmy computer in the game of TIC TAC TOE -&nbsp;\n100 USD reward \u2013 all tried and failed.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TO MAKE A CHOOT OUT OF\nMY FRIENDS I MADE&nbsp; &nbsp;\u201c IF MY AUNTY HAD BALLS\n, SHE WOULD BE MY UNCLE \u201c&nbsp; &nbsp;TYPE PROGRAMS\n. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I HAD HAJAAAAR FUN !<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>TODAY SOME SMART\nCONTRACT PROGRAMERS USE \u201cSOLIDITY \u201c AS A PROGRAMMING&nbsp; LANGUAGE</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/R_CiemcFKis/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/R_CiemcFKis?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">Solidity is language with a syntax very similar\nto ECMAScript (Javascript). &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/v_hU0jPtLto/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/v_hU0jPtLto?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Solidity is a\nstatically-typed programming language designed for developing smart contracts .&nbsp;&nbsp; Solidity is compiled to bytecode that is\nexecutable on the EVM.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With Solidity, developers are able to write applications\nthat implement self-enforcing business logic embodied in smart contracts,\nleaving a non-repudiable and authoritative record of transactions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Writing\nsmart contracts in smart contract specific languages such as Solidity is\nreferred to as easy -- only for those who already have programming skills<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/VWaVPhQqeyA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/VWaVPhQqeyA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Solidity is a\ncontract-oriented, high-level language whose syntax is similar to that of\nJavaScript and it is designed to target the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Solidity is statically\ntyped, supports inheritance, libraries and complex user-defined types among\nother features.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is possible to\ncreate contracts for voting, crowd funding, blind auctions, multi-signature\nwallets and more.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/nnVX6fQUu4o/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/nnVX6fQUu4o?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On November 1, 2016, a\ncompiler bug that could have affected all contracts deployed with Solidity was\ndiscovered. &nbsp;&nbsp;Taking advantage of a compiler bug, &nbsp;malicious attackers used an overflow bug and\nrewrote storage variables. &nbsp;The bug was\nfixed immediately, not before several vital contracts were affected and had to\nbe redeployed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Cornell University\nresearcher stated that Solidity was partially to blame for The DAO hack that\ntook place in 2016. He stated: \"this was actually not a flaw or exploit in\nthe DAO contract itself: technically the EVM was operating as intended, but\nSolidity was introducing security flaws into contracts that were not only\nmissed by the community, but missed by the designers of the language\nthemselves.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.cryptocoinsnews.com/ethereum-solidity-flaw-dao/\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.cryptocoinsnews.com/ethereum-solidity-flaw-dao/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart-contracts are a\nway for people all across the globe to do business with each other even if they\ndon\u2019t speak the same language or use the same currency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart-contracts have\ntheir own address, from which they can receive and send Ether. Smart contracts\ncan track the \u201ccaller\u201d of the function in a verifiable way, so it can determine\nif one of its functions is being called by a privileged \u201cowner\u201d or \u201cadmin\u201d\naccount, and act accordingly for administrative functions.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They have the ability\nto read data from the Ethereum blockchain, and access info on transactions in\nolder blocks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/aV8C77xAaQA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/aV8C77xAaQA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart contracts can be\nembedded with advanced access control criteria that allow only authorized users\nto create transactions.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A well-designed blockchain should have a\nprecise and dynamically controlled system to designate the roles of connecting\nto the blockchain, initiating transactions, and creating assets. In addition,\nthe relevant criteria could be encoded in smart contracts to ensure all\nconditions have been met before recognizing any sales revenue. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart contracts could add intelligence into\naccounting processes by integrating big data and PREDICTIVE &nbsp;analytics. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Combined with big data, smart contracts could\nlayer on top of the reactive-to-predictive transformation to achieve a dynamic,\nself-optimal, risk-aware measurement of companies\u2019 performance. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By encoding a fraud prediction model into a\nsmart contract, a credit card company could adjust the credit limit of an\naccount based on the spending behavior of the account holders .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, a smart contract\nis any agreement that can automatically enforce terms between two or more\nindividuals or entities without the need for a third party. &nbsp;Embedded, repeatable, and data-driven logic\ntriggers transactions in response to predefined conditions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Written as a\ncomputer program rather than legal language on a printed document, the\nagreement is executed against strict rules and consequences in the same manner\nas a paper-based document. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Information\nis captured and monitored for compliance, and the smart contract can actually\ntake action on behalf of the offended party if any terms are breached.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the programming\nlanguage of blockchain technology, smart contracts can drive actions such as\nsecuring collateral, determining futures, and structuring repayment\nprioritization.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No one wants to take a customer\nor partner to court to settle noncompliance. Reputations are at stake, and the\nrelationship is often irreparable. &nbsp;&nbsp;With\nsmart contracting, the terms are laid out and digitally monitored without bias.&nbsp; &nbsp;If a\nviolation occurs, the predefined consequence, agreed on by both parties, is\nautomatically triggered. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example,\nby storing loan terms as well as collateral ownership information in the\nblockchain, the lending entity can revoke the borrower\u2019s digital keys that\ngrant access to collateral if a payment is missed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart contracts can be\nused to set up escrow accounts, control wallets, and handle stocks and bonds.\nThe buyer of a good or service can transfer payments to a particular account. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An escrow account is a\ntemporary pass through account held by a third party during the process of a\ntransaction between two parties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The blockchain would\nthen monitor services rendered and determine whether ownership has been\ntransferred properly. If all defined rules are followed, payment is released to\nthe seller.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plus, withdrawal limits\ncan be set so that portions of the total amount are released based on the\nprogress of the service being rendered.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through smart\ncontracts, companies can establish a distributed registry to validate product\nauthenticity and goods ownership, and authenticate complaints and warranty\nclaims. The process can also verify the identification of authorized persons\nand detect patterns of potentially fraudulent behavior.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Self-validated,\nself-monitored, and self-enforced, smart contracts can bridge the trust gap in\nmany contract-creation and management processes without the need for a\nthird-party intermediary.&nbsp; Finance\norganizations have a significant opportunity to strengthen transaction\nsecurity, increase contract compliance, and reduce the risk of term\nmanipulation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blockchain is an open\ninfrastructure technology that enables users operating outside of an organizational\nor network boundary to execute transactions directly with each other. &nbsp;Blockchain\u2019s fundamental value proposition is\nanchored in this universal availability.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, a smart contract\nrunning on a blockchain is run by a massive set of computers, rather than being\ncontrolled by a small cluster or just one server. This means that everyone gets\nto be aware of the inputs, calculations and results.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because of blockchain\u2019s\ninherent decentralized technology, smart contracts allow individuals to achieve\nan agreement between themselves, without the need to pay for a trusted intermediary,\nsuch as a bank, notary or lawyer in case of a dispute. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no downtime,\ncensorship, fraud or interference\u2014when things are done the right way. &nbsp;Code will be executed exactly as it logic\ndetermines, there is no space for multiple interpretation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are six criteria\nthat are tested as part of processing integrity, which include:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1: Procedures exist to\nprevent, or detect and correct, processing errors to meet the entity\u2019s\nprocessing integrity commitments and system requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2: System inputs are\nmeasured and recorded completely, accurately, and timely to meet the entity\u2019s\nprocessing integrity commitments and system requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3: Data is processed\ncompletely, accurately, and timely as authorized to meet the entity\u2019s\nprocessing integrity commitments and system requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4: Data is stored and\nmaintained completely, accurately, and in a timely manner for its specified life\nspan to meet the entity\u2019s processing integrity commitments and system\nrequirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5: System output is\ncomplete, accurate, and distributed to meet the entity\u2019s processing integrity\ncommitments and system requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6: Modification of\ndata, other than routine transaction processing, is authorized and processed to\nmeet with the entity\u2019s processing integrity commitments and system\nrequirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A smart contract is a\ndigital contract that is automatically enforced when certain conditions are\nfulfilled. All the documents required for the contract are digitised and put on\nblockchain, where the network validates them. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By doing away with\npaper documentation, the smart contract straightaway eliminates document fraud,\nand also the risk of loss during transit. Now, only genuine users with\nestablished identity and ownership can transact, and that too in full view of\nthe blockchain network.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A huge use case for the\nsmart contract is property dealings. &nbsp;&nbsp;Digitising\nland records on blockchain would foil the intentions of fraudsters misusing a\nGeneral Power of Attorney or access to title documents to lay false claim to\nproperty.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition, a smart property contract would curb tax evasion by\nmaking make the terms of transaction open and transparent to the regulatory\nauthorities.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CRIMINAL SMART CONTRACT\nPROGRAMMERS ARE BEING USED IN THE ART WORLD BY WHITE JEWS TO SELL FAKES AS\nORIGINALS..&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_10B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; text-decoration-line: none;\">October 15, 2017 at 12:17 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_12MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nWE HAVE SEVERAL SUNDAR PICHAI TYPE INDIANS DOING VERY WELL IN USA.<br />\n<br />\nMY ELDER SON RECALLS ANOTHER GOLD MEDALLIST ( NO NAMES ).&nbsp; HE IS A CTO-- HE PARTLY OWNS THE COMPANY HINT--TAMILIAN<br />\n<br />\nMY SON HAD GONE TO THE COMPANY IN USA FOR AN INTERVIEW<br />\n<br />\n5 PEOPLE DID HIS TESTS<br />\n<br />\nMY SON SAYS -- ALL 5 WERE STUPID - THE FIRST WAS CHINESE , HE WAS BETTER THAN THE REST<br />\n<br />\nAFTER WRITING CODE IN JAVA -- THEY WANT HIM TO WRITE THE SAME IN SOME \"DINOSAUR\" METHOD --BECAUSE THEIR BRAINS CANT GO BEYOND THAT<br />\n<br />\nHE HAD TO EXPLAIN HIS CODES TO THEM WITH DIAGRAMS -- THEY WERE STILL SCRATCHING THEIR HEADS-- THE CODES RAN PERFECT WITHOUT BUGS .<br />\n<br />\nTHE BEST PART IS THIS COMPANY GETS BACK TO HIM AFTER 4 DAYS AND SAYS -- WE EXPECTED BETTER IN CODING<br />\n<br />\nMY SON SAID--&nbsp; \"OK,&nbsp; NO PROBS !\"<br />\n<br />\nTHEN AFTER THREE MORE DAYS THE FEMALE RECRUITER CALLS HIM AND SAYS --&nbsp; THE COMPANY SAYS THEY MADE A MISTAKE WITH THE CODING EVALUATION--THEY NOW SAY IT IS OUT OF THE WORLD<br />\n<br />\nBUT BUT BUT<br />\n<br />\nTHEY NOW SAY YOUR ARCHITECTURE ROUND COULD HAVE BEEN BETTER<br />\n<br />\nMY SON TOLD \" I INVENTED THIS UNIQUE DESIGN IN THE COMPANY I AM WORKING IN RIGHT NOW -- IT IS BEING USED WORLD WIDE BY MORE THAN 50 COMPANIES --AND ALL HAVE GONE GA GA OVER IT \"<br />\n<br />\nHE SAID-- I AM DONE WITH THIS INDIAN BOSS OUTFIT-- I NEED NO FURTHER INFO<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart contracts are\ndefined as &nbsp;user-defined programs that\nspecify rules-governing transactions.&nbsp; For\nexample, a person\u2019s last will could be encoded as a smart contract so that the\ninheritance could be automatically bequeathed to recipients if predetermined\nconditions . &nbsp;After one year of my death ,\nmy wife has not FUCKED someone &nbsp;else, &nbsp;as per my personal detective .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart contracts can\nsecurely operate on a blockchain; any party can perform verification of\ntransactions in compliance with the embedded rules.&nbsp; &nbsp;Blockchain\nusers can program their own rules into a smart contract to execute specific\ntasks. &nbsp;&nbsp;For example, management can\nencode company-specific rules into smart contracts to enable automatic controls&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because the hub and\nspoke model is centralised, day-to-day operations can be relatively inflexible,\nand changes at the hub, even in a single route, may have unexpected\nconsequences throughout the network. It may be difficult or even impossible to\nhandle occasional periods of high demand between two spokes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conventional databases\nuse a \u201chub and spoke\u201d structure in which a central computer, or server,\nprovides access to individual users. &nbsp;&nbsp;In\ncontrast blockchain is a distributed database without a centralized server. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though nodes do not\nhave to depend on one another in order to operate, they do have to depend on\nthe central hub. If something happens to this central hub, the whole network\nbecomes unusable because there is no pathway through which data may be\ntransmitted.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many high-value business needs require fine-grained,\nnon-enterprise data.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To move this specialized, business function-centric\ncontent through a hub-and-spoke network designed to support large-volume,\ngeneralized data is not only inefficient but more costly..</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If\neveryone\u2019s needs are homogenous and well-defined, using the data warehouse for\ndata provisioning is just fine. The flaw of hub-and-spoke is that it doesn\u2019t\naddress issues of timeliness and latency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qrHLWz8W7rs/WeMaQx5qVOI/AAAAAAABWNw/Iz3vxRJbaIMBCriMmPVy1sP4tLklGwyOQCLcBGAs/s1600/kkIC269938.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"314\" data-original-width=\"530\" height=\"378\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qrHLWz8W7rs/WeMaQx5qVOI/AAAAAAABWNw/Iz3vxRJbaIMBCriMmPVy1sP4tLklGwyOQCLcBGAs/s640/kkIC269938.gif\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">New data (\u201cblocks\u201d) are added to a shared\nelectronic ledger by members of a \u201cpeer-to-peer\u201d network.&nbsp; &nbsp;Data\ncan include such things as the record of an event, a document or executable\ncode (smart contract). &nbsp;Blockchain\nrecords are difficult (if not impossible) to change without detection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conventional databases\nuse a \u201chub and spoke\u201d structure in which a central computer, or server,\nprovides access to individual users. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is old traditional\narchitecture where a single integration server, the hub, handles the\ninformation exchange and transformation for many applications or data stores,\nthe spokes.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In contrast blockchain\nis a distributed database without a centralized server. &nbsp;&nbsp;New data (blocks) are added to a shared\nelectronic ledger by members of a \u201cpeer-to-peer\u201d network.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Data\ncan include such things as the record of an event, a document or executable\ncode (smart contract). &nbsp;Blockchain\nrecords are difficult (if not impossible) to change without detection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is also anchored in\nintegrity. When someone adds a block, or executes a blockchain-based smart\ncontract, those additions are immutable. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A smart&nbsp; contract can manipulate inputs using defined\nalgorithms, store data and provide outputs suiting the needs of an application.\n&nbsp;One contract can also interact with\nother contracts, reusing its code, and taking advantage from a set of already\nestablished rules and can consolidate them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart contracts are a\nform of automated contracts that use pre-defined rules to facilitate the\nexchange of nearly any good or service. The overarching principle is to\nincrease the transparency of the transaction while reducing fees and allaying\nthe potential for conflict over nonperformance. However, unlike traditional\ncontracts, these contracts have no room for conscious interpretation because\nall terms are predetermined and automatically enforced by the contract itself. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A simple analogy for\nunderstanding the purpose would be pizza delivery. In this example, a pizzeria\npromises 30-minute delivery for a pie or money back guaranteed. The pizzeria\nwould then create a smart contract with a customer ordering a pie. The customer\ncould put the funds in escrow, and if the pizza is delivered within 30 minutes,\nthe funds are released from escrow to the pizzeria. If the pizzeria fails to\ndeliver on time, the money held in escrow is returned to the customer. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Don\u2019t read too uch into the pizza thingy\u2014it is\njust an example for duffers.&nbsp; This simple\nexample readily illustrates how smart contracts can be applied across nearly\nany activity that requires some sort of contract to establish trust and\nsecurity between parties.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart contracts are very\ncarefully designed to carry out specially designed functions and tasks without\nthe intervention of either of the parties which could result in the breach of\nsaid contract. In the event of a breach, the contract is optimized to ensure\nthat the other party is not damaged by the violation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The principle of\nkeeping funds in escrow, for instance, is completely solved by smart contracts\nwithout the need for an especially complicated legal framework that requires\nfees or a broker. Each side is protected by the agreement. If the seller fails\nto deliver on all the terms of the contract, the other party keeps their funds\nor other deliverable. The reverse is also true if the buyer fails to post the\nfunds in escrow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apart from being a\nmagnificent risk-management tool, smart contracts can effectively remove trust\nfrom the transactability equation.&nbsp; It is\na win-win scenario for all participants involved.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Smart contracts are a\nhelpful innovation accompanying many blockchain activities, helping end-users\nbenefit by lowering fees, hastening transaction speeds, ensuring performance,\nand increasing protections for associated parties entering into an agreement.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can think of smart\ncontracts as good old stored procedures of relational databases. However,\ncombined with other blockchain properties, like immutability, trust, and\nsecurity, their potential is much greater. &nbsp;Blockchain is a shared trusted database, but\nit\u2019s an inefficient one.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What makes blockchain unique is the fact that it can\nsafely store value. Safely storing value makes blockchain a trading platform,\nwhich in turn makes smart contracts trading agents. With smart contracts, you\ncan automate the exchange of value, in a trusted and safe way.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Use smart contracts to\nencode the rules of new businesses that are enabled by the new platform. Rules are\nthe terms and conditions that trading parties have agreed upon to formalize and\nsecure their transactions. &nbsp;The code\nautomatically enforces those rules, completely removing people from the\nequation, closing the door to most of fraud, corruption, and incorrect\ninterpretation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many commodity trading\ncompanies accumulate aging accounts receivable on the balance sheet that are eventually\nwritten off in their annual audited accounts.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">. Laytime is the\namount of time allowed (in hours or days) in a voyage charter for the loading\nand unloading of cargo. If the laytime is exceeded, demurrage is incurred and\ncould be claimed for.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cash collection of the demurrage claims\nhas turned out to be challenging. Companies often choose to walk away instead\nof pursuing a debt in court. Resources required to chase a debt might exceed\nthe value of the debt. And, ultimately, the long term partner relationships may\nbeat the intention to fight for debt recovery.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shipping\nlegislation is old and it has developed over centuries in a complex and often\nambiguous code prone to interpretations.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nTerms and conditions of a charter agreement could be used to set up a\ntemplate for a smart contract.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once a charter agreement is signed between two\nparties, the details of it are filled in the smart contract that is then ready\nfor execution.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pressure of collecting all necessary\ndocuments to support a claim before being time barred could be eliminated by\nhaving all documents already saved on a blockchain and contributing to a smart\ncontract execution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Currently, most of the\nshipping transactions involve a big number of papers, such as sales contracts,\ncharter party agreements, bills of lading, port documents, letters of credit\nand others related with the vessel and the cargo. All these documents may need\nto pass through a long chain of parties since their importance remains high\nboth for various payments to be effected as well as the carriage and delivery\nof the cargo to take place.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Look, for example, into the bills of lading and the\nlong way they follow: Starting from the shippers at load port, they pass\nthrough several banks until they reach the receiver. This procedure can be so\nlengthy and time-consuming that it is very common the vessels to arrive at the\ndischarge port before the bills of lading. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blockchain could turn\nthe whole processes into a paperless paradise by which all the related parties\nin each transaction (i.e. sellers/buyers of cargo, shipowner, charterer, banks,\nagents, customs, port authorities etc.) with the use of public and private keys\ncould come in contact with each other, perform physical transactions, exchange\nand store information in encrypted format and perform their contractual\nobligations, give and accept instructions and securely exchange payments. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These charter-party and\nbill of lading terms and conditions will be standard part of the software and\nwill not be able to change by the parties. This way, we are moving to a digital\nmarket where a contract will be published by the Owner or the Charterer and the\nother party will negotiate the price/freight directly via the blockchain\nnetwork.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then, the smart contracts will be executed by a computer network that\nuses consensus protocols to determine the sequence of actions which result from\nthe contract\u2019s code and this way to automate calculations, approvals and other\ntransacting activities. Before the use of blockchain, this type of smart\ncontract was impossible to happen because parties to an agreement would\nmaintain separate databases.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With a shared database that runs a blockchain\nprotocol, the smart contracts auto-execute, and all parties validate the\noutcome instantaneously, without wasting time on further exchanges and without\nthe need for a third-party intermediary. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adapting a blockchain\ntechnology, such as the Smart Contracts, could have the following advantages\nfor the shipping industry. \u2014 ---</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quick processing time and real-time updates:\nInstead of mailing the documents to various parties, the exchange of\ninformation can become instantly and procedures which currently take weeks to\nbe completed even within a few minutes. The software code of blockchain will\nalso automate tasks that are typically accomplished manually. \u2014&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Higher\naccuracy: Since all the execution of contracts and other processes are\nautomated, the errors are much less possible. \u2014&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Full Transparency: The\ninformation is stored in a place where everyone can have access provided that\nhe has the required access key. This gives full transparency to market\nparticipants and also the counter-party risk is easier evaluated when anyone\ncan have access to the transactions previously performed by each party. \u2014&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Increased security: All information is encrypted, something which adds security\nby its own. Also, the fact that the users can not interfere with the system and\nchange the information stored in the blockchain protects the market from\nfraudulent activities and various documentary manipulations. \u2014&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cost Saving: A\nbig part of the trade financing costs is related to documentation, procedural\ndelays, discrepancies or errors. These costs can be omitted and total cost\ncurrently spent to various intermediaries will be avoided and replaced by a\nmuch cheaper cost of the blockchain. \u2014&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Easier access to the market: Everyone\ncan have access to the blockchain technology and therefore the entry barriers\nwill be less and the market will become more competitive. Furthermore, the\nparties will be able to develop direct communication without the need of\nintermediaries and the overall chain will become lighter. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/charterers-on-chemical-tankers-capt.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/charterers-on-chemical-tankers-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/10/commercial-matters-on-chemical-tankers.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/10/commercial-matters-on-chemical-tankers.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/gzr9gYgucu0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/gzr9gYgucu0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This blogsite warns India \u2013 do NOT get into\nBLOCKCHAIN deals with foreign entities , like CKDs ( CHOOTS KA DHAKKANS ) till we have got our act\ntogether . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Right now nobody knows a\nshit and they are jumping off the deep end-- <b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">APUN TELUGU&nbsp; BLOCKCHAINULU&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></b>. ( <span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b>or is it UDU instead of ULU ?</b></span>)</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Overblown expectations with limited knowledge\nand scanty information is recipe for failure and enormous waste of money<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Getting back to basics --a smart contract is\na piece of code that is stored on an blockchain, triggered by blockchain\ntransactions and which reads and writes data in that blockchain's database.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Because a blockchain is a consensus-based\nsystem, meaning that it only works if every node reaches an identical state\nafter processing every transaction and block.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A smart contract is just a fancy name for\ncode that runs on a blockchain, and interacts with that blockchain's\nstate.&nbsp; &nbsp;Just because the name is smart-it does not\nmean it is ekdum smart<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Everything that takes place on a blockchain\nmust be completely deterministic, with no possible way for differences to creep\nin.&nbsp;&nbsp; The moment that two honest nodes\ndisagree about the chain's state, the entire system falls PHUTTTT on its face<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts are executed independently by\nevery node on a chain. Therefore, if a smart contract retrieves some\ninformation from an external source, this retrieval is performed repeatedly and\nseparately by each node.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But because this source is outside of the blockchain,\nthere is no guarantee that every node will receive the same answer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Perhaps the source will change its response in\nthe time between requests from different nodes, or perhaps it will become\ntemporarily unavailable. Either way, consensus is broken and the entire\nblockchain goes PHUTTTT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Solution ?&nbsp;\n&nbsp;Instead of a smart contract\ninitiating the retrieval of external data, one or more trusted parties (oracles\n) creates a transaction which embeds that data in the chain.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Every node will\nhave an identical copy of this data, so it can be safely used in a smart\ncontract computation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This way an oracle pushes the data onto the\nblockchain rather than a smart contract pulling it in.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1tOm3RfuHZ4/WeRo5A3auDI/AAAAAAABWPk/9dbCBXb8BIEITNAFRaFXQldc9m74NZ4AwCLcBGAs/s1600/528_aHR0cHM6Ly9jb2ludGVsEZWdyYXBoLmNvbS9zdG9yYWdlL3VwbG9hZHMvdmlldy9iMzQyYWIyNDdkZTNkNjYzOGNiYjg2NTE1YzFlYWZhMC5qcGc%253D.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"351\" data-original-width=\"528\" height=\"265\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1tOm3RfuHZ4/WeRo5A3auDI/AAAAAAABWPk/9dbCBXb8BIEITNAFRaFXQldc9m74NZ4AwCLcBGAs/s400/528_aHR0cHM6Ly9jb2ludGVsEZWdyYXBoLmNvbS9zdG9yYWdlL3VwbG9hZHMvdmlldy9iMzQyYWIyNDdkZTNkNjYzOGNiYjg2NTE1YzFlYWZhMC5qcGc%253D.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts are touted as having the\npotential to do all kinds amazing things. But, to fulfill their promise, they\nneed a way to communicate with the outside world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">That is not so easily done. Due of the nature\nof a blockchain (all nodes need to agree on any change in state of the\ndatabase), smart contracts cannot simply fetch data on their own.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts are unable to communicate\ndirectly with the outside world, mainly for reasons of efficiency and security.&nbsp; &nbsp; As a result, they do not reach out for data.. Instead, data aimed at changing\nthe state of a contract need to be pushed onto the blockchain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Oracles provide a connection between online\ndata feeds and smart contracts. Through an oracle every node on the network\nwill receive the exact same data when executing a smart contract.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This is\ncrucial as the blockchain is based on a consensus mechanism and all nodes have\nto agree on a certain state when processing transactions and blocks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To give you an example, imagine a smart\ncontract that pays out a dividend if the profit of an organization exceeds a\ncertain threshold.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Who is going to the tell the smart contract whether the\npayout threshold has been reached?&nbsp; This\nis where oracles come in.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">They collect data from one or more data providers,\nprovide evidence that they did no modify the data themselves and then push them\nonto the blockchain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An Oracle (data feed) is a third-party\nservice that provides external data when needed and is designed for use with\nSmart Contracts.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart Contracts are\ndesigned to execute a specific command when exposed to relevant data triggers&nbsp; &nbsp;.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart Contracts are just&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">is a piece of code which is\nstored on an blockchain, triggered by blockchain transactions, and which reads\nand writes data in that blockchain\u2019s database.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An Oracle pushes these data inputs into the\nBlockchain so that they may trigger Smart Contracts.&nbsp; &nbsp;Oracles are part of\nmulti-signature contracts where for example the original trustees sign a\ncontract for future release of funds only if certain conditions are met.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Before\nany funds get released an Oracle must sign the Smart Contract as well.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An Oracle finds and verifies real world\noccurrences. Then, it submits the verified information on the specific\nBlockchain, so that it can be utilized by Smart Contracts.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">However, the vice\nversa is also true, i.e. an Oracle may also submit information from a Smart\nContract to the outside world.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Based on the type of use, Oracles are\ndifferentiated into the following types:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Software Oracles:&nbsp; &nbsp;These Oracles handle online\ninformation such as data originated from online sources like websites, for\nexample, the price of gold or weather fluctuations.
