They extract the required\ninformation and push it into the Smart Contracts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hardware Oracles:&nbsp; Many use cases of Blockchain requires data\ninputs from hardware in the physical world. These can be damage sensors in a\ncar or RFID sensors in a Supply Chain. The role the Hardware Oracle is to\nprovide readings without sacrificing data security.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Inbound Oracles:&nbsp; Provide data from the external world, like an\nautomatic buy order if the USD reaches a specific price.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Outbound Oracles:&nbsp; These act as a medium of communication from\nSmart Contracts to the Outside World. They can send data to the outside world\nfrom Smart Contracts, for example, consider the use case of a Smart Lock in the\nPhysical world which needs to unlock automatically after receiving a payment on\nits Blockchain address.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Consensus Based Oracles:&nbsp; This is a combination of multiple Oracles,\nwherein data from multiple sources is required to reduce risk, like market\npredictions for confirming future outcomes. A decision is made based on the\nconsensus of a maximum number of Oracles. For example, 7 out of 10 oracles\ncould determine the outcome of an event.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Though Oracles, like any Smart Contract, are\nautonomous. Still, they are not part of the Blockchain consensus mechanism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An oracle, in the context of blockchains and\nsmart contracts, is an agent that finds and verifies real-world occurrences and\nsubmits this information to a blockchain to be used by smart contracts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts contain value and only unlock\nthat value if certain pre-defined conditions are met. When a particular value\nis reached, the smart contract changes its state and executes the\nprogrammatically predefined algorithms, automatically triggering an event on\nthe blockchain.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The primary task of oracles is to provide\nthese values to the smart contract in a secure and trusted manner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Again, blockchains cannot access data outside\ntheir network.&nbsp; An oracle is a data feed\n\u2013 provided by third party service \u2013 designed for use in smart contracts on the\nblockchain.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Oracles provide external\ndata and trigger smart contract executions when pre-defined conditions meet .&nbsp; Oracles are third party services which are\nnot part of the blockchain consensus mechanism<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Oracles are part of multi-signature contracts\nwhere for example the original trustees sign a contract for future release of\nfunds only if certain conditions are met. Before any funds get released an\noracle has to sign the smart contract as well.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Instead of a smart contract initiating the\nretrieval of external data, one or more trusted parties (oracles) creates a\ntransaction which embeds that data in the chain.&nbsp;&nbsp; Every node will have an identical copy of\nthis data, so it can be safely used in a smart contract computation. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An oracle pushes the data onto the blockchain\nrather than a smart contract pulling it in.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchains provide radical transparency...\nFor example, if ten banks set up a blockchain together, and three conduct a\nbilateral transaction, this will be immediately visible to the other seven.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Some people think that smart contracts can\nsolve this problem. They start with the fact that each smart contract contains\nits own miniature database, over which it has full control. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">All read and write operations on this\ndatabase are mediated by the contract\u2019s code, making it impossible for one\ncontract to read another\u2019s data directly.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This tight coupling between data and code is\ncalled encapsulation, and is the foundation of the popular object-oriented\nprogramming paradigm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Does it make any sense to talk of hiding\ninformation in a smart contract?&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Unfortunately, the answer is no. Because even if one smart contract\ncan\u2019t read another\u2019s data, that data is still stored on every single node in\nthe chain. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For each blockchain participant, it\u2019s in the\nmemory or disk of a system which that participant completely controls. And\nthere\u2019s nothing to stop them reading the information from their own system, if\nand when they choose to do so.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hiding data in a smart contract is about as\nsecure as hiding it in the HTML code of a web page. Sure, regular web users\nwon\u2019t see it, because it\u2019s not displayed in their browser window. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But all it takes is for a web browser to add\na \u2018View Source\u2019 function (as they all have), and the hidden information becomes\nuniversally visible.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Similarly, for data hidden in smart\ncontracts, all it takes is for some halfwit programmer to modify their\nblockchain software to display the contract\u2019s full state, and all semblance of\nsecrecy is lost.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A blockchain enables a database to be\ndirectly and safely shared by entities who do not trust each other, without\nrequiring a central administrator. Blockchains enable data disintermediation,\nand this can lead to significant savings in complexity and cost.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In a regular centralized database, these\ntransactions are created by a single trusted authority. By contrast, in a\nblockchain-driven shared database, transactions can be created by any of that\nblockchain\u2019s users.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">And since these users do not fully trust each\nother, the database has to contain rules which restrict the transactions\nperformed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For example, in a peer-to-peer financial ledger, each transaction\nmust preserve the total quantity of funds, otherwise participants could freely\ngive themselves as much money as they liked.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts are simply one method for\nrestricting the transactions performed in a database. This is undoubtedly a\nuseful thing, and is essential to making that database safe for sharing. But\nsmart contracts cannot do anything else, and they certainly cannot escape the\nboundaries of the database in which they reside.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Oracles allow smart contracts to access\ninformation, like commodity, currency, derivative pricing and more, from\nwebsites, and then use that data to implement the terms of a smart contract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But oracles come with their own set of\nchallenges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For example, an oracle needs to be able to\nprovide a tamper-proof source of information. So, if your smart contract offers\ninsurance against flight cancellations, you want to make sure that the data you\nare getting on flights is accurate, and has not been altered at any point after\nbeing scraped from the website.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Confidential queries are another issue. Say,\na smart contract needs information on a personal bank statement or a medical\nrecord. A query from the oracle to the website would need to contain login,\npassword or other private information. And you don't want anyone seeing that.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Cornell has have launched an oracle service\nthat allows ethereum smart contracts to obtain trustworthy information and to\nsecurely send confidential queries to websites.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Since a blockchain cannot access data outside\nof it, an oracle is needed to push external data that may not be baked into\nsmart contracts because these fluctuate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Oracle has jumped on the\nblockchain bandwagon, in the quest to streamline and secure operations through\nthe virtually unhackable, self-verifying technology.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A blockchain is just a database--&nbsp;&nbsp; the biggest challenge in deploying\nblockchains is the radical transparency which they provide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Again, even if one smart contract can\u2019t read\nanother\u2019s data, that data is still stored on every single node in the chain. &nbsp;For each blockchain participant, it\u2019s in the\nmemory or disk of a system which that participant completely controls. And\nthere\u2019s nothing to stop them reading the information from their own system, if\nand when they choose to do so.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contract for a financial ledger\nperforms the same three tasks as the administrator of a centralized database:\nchecking for sufficient funds, deducting from one account and adding to\nanother.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The working definition of a \"smart\ncontract\" is a consensual arrangement between at least two parties for an\nautomated, independent commercial result from the satisfaction or\nnon-satisfaction, determined objectively through code, of a specific factual\ncondition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But are&nbsp;\nsmart contracts really contracts?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A contract is \"an agreement between two\nor more parties creating obligations that are enforceable or otherwise\nrecognizable at law.\"&nbsp;&nbsp; For an\nagreement to be enforceable or otherwise recognizable at law three particular\nelements must be present:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An offer (basically, expression of a\nwillingness to enter into a binding agreement subject to the offeree's\nacceptance of the proposed terms);--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">---An acceptance of those terms<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">----A mutual exchange of value \u2013 so-called\n\"consideration.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">---Legally binding agreements identify the\nparties and subject matter with particularity, and include mutual promises,\nwhich may be absolute or subject to conditions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The legal system offers remedies for the\nbreach of a legally binding agreement, such as a requirement to pay damages or,\nin certain circumstances, a court order mandating performance under penalty of\nlaw.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts can be, but are not\nnecessarily, legally binding contracts. This is why India must be careful while\ndealing with white <b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">SHYLOCK TYPE JEWS</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/4vE0g98y4_s/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/4vE0g98y4_s?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-d4IR1_pxQe0/WeTAXxgjUnI/AAAAAAABWP4/esdJDVvIjScvLtsbDoHpQshEsfBueVEmgCLcBGAs/s1600/event-itnJig-smart-contracts-by-marketpay-juan-ignacio-prez-sacristn-5-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"275\" data-original-width=\"559\" height=\"314\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-d4IR1_pxQe0/WeTAXxgjUnI/AAAAAAABWP4/esdJDVvIjScvLtsbDoHpQshEsfBueVEmgCLcBGAs/s640/event-itnJig-smart-contracts-by-marketpay-juan-ignacio-prez-sacristn-5-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Nick Szabo's vending machine transaction is a\nproto-smart contract, consistent with the working definition: insert a dollar\nand automatically receive a can of soda. Now in the case of this vending\nmachine transaction, there actually is a legally binding contract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Stocking the vending machine with soft drinks\nand inviting passersby to insert a dollar to purchase one constitutes an offer.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Inserting that dollar constitutes acceptance.\nThe dollar and soda, respectively, are consideration. And while it would be\npetty to sue over a dollar, if the machine eats my dollar without giving me a\nsoda, I would have legal recourse.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/0AkcWjB0UBE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/0AkcWjB0UBE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But a smart contract may represent only a\ncomponent of, or means of performing a component of, a legally binding\ncontract, rather than an entire contract.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The writing evidencing a legally binding\nagreement can be electronic (with an electronic \"click-through\nagreement\" representing a typical example). In the context of blockchain\ntechnology, it is possible to record an agreement \u2013 or a cryptographic hash of\nan agreement \u2013 as metadata within a blockchain.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts can be said to be\n\"smart\" to the extent they offer the efficiency of automated\ncontractual performance and reduce the risk of human error and prospects of a dispute.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But barring quantum improvements in\nartificial intelligence, the utility of smart contracts is limited to\nsituations where the satisfaction or non-satisfaction of a particular factual\ncondition is objectively ascertainable through programmatic reference to an\nextrinsic data source (oracle).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the context of commercial agreements, a\ncomputer can be programmed, say, to use an oracle to ascertain whether LIBOR\nhas increased or decreased. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The London Interbank Offered Rate is the\naverage of interest rates estimated by each of the leading banks in London that\nit would be charged were it to borrow from other banks. Libor is the daily\nmeasure showing the interest rate at which banks lend to each other. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the rigging scandal, which came to light\nin 2012, traders from a number of banks artificially manipulated the rate in\norder to profit more than they should have done.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-libor-settlement/citi-deutsche-bank-hsbc-agree-to-pay-132-million-to-settle-libor-claims-idUSKBN1CH36N\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.reuters.com/article/us-libor-settlement/citi-deutsche-bank-hsbc-agree-to-pay-132-million-to-settle-libor-claims-idUSKBN1CH36N</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The smart contract acts as an impartial\njudge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A Smart contract could encompass a range of\ncomplex results based on multiple inputs. But a computer cannot (today, at\nleast) be programmed to accurately ascertain, for example, whether or not a party\nto a merger agreement has used reasonable best efforts to obtain a regulatory\napproval.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Viewed through this prism, smart contracts aren't actually smart;\nthey are deterministic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">And given that computer code is as\nsusceptible to error as prose and that legally binding agreements must be\nsubject to judicial enforcement, as the use of smart contracts grows, in the\ncontext of sophisticated agreements providing for ongoing performance-- it will\nbe necessary to maintain safety valves (in the context of blockchain\ntechnology, perhaps in the form of private keys) for a court or arbitrator to\nbe able override smart contractual provisions.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">In March 2017, Arizona USA enacted legislation\nlegalizing smart contracts --defined in the law as \"an event-driven\nprogram, with state, that runs on a distributed, decentralized, shared and\nreplicated ledger and that can take custody over and instruct transfer of\nassets on that ledger\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A blockchain is a database that provides\nproof of who owns what at any given moment and an immutable record of all\ntransactions-- a distributed ledger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts encoded with accounting and\nbusiness rules could also provide efficient controls of business processes in\norder to prevent fraud. Smart contracts can be embedded with advanced access\ncontrol criteria that allow only authorized users to create transactions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts have the potential to\neliminate the need for trusted third parties to facilitate transactions. In the\ncase of real estate agreements, contracts could be verified and enforced\nautomatically without the need for human interaction, reducing the need for\nagents, lenders, inspectors and title insurance providers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Blockchain technology provides a better\nopportunity for more accurate tracking of customers and owners histories,\nacross borders and banks, reducing the risk of defaulters. Blockchain\ntechnology can contain a huge amount of data, including entire contracts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts eliminate the middleman, such\nas a legal firm, as payment will happen based on certain milestones being met.\nBy its very nature, the smart contract is easily enforceable electronically,\ncreating a powerful escrow by taking it out of the control of a single party.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An\nescrow is a financial arrangement where a third party holds and regulates\npayment of the funds required for two parties involved in a given transaction<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THE ADVANTAGES OF A USING SMART CONTACT OVER\nA TRADITIONAL CONTRACT ARE-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Trustless\u200a\u2014\u200aThe open-source nature of the\nSmart contracts means that it will execute exactly as the source code dictates.\nThis allows one entity to confidently transact value directly with another\nentity without relying on a third party to stand between them and ensure that\neach honours the transaction agreement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Autonomous\u200a\u2014\u200aA Smart contract exists on a\nBlockchain where it will self-execute according to the pre-agreed contract\nconditions without any direct human involvement.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Self-sufficient\u200a\u2014\u200aSmart contracts are stored\npermanently on a Blockchain where they have all the resources permanently\navailable to them in order to execute and remain in existence. Once published a\nsmart contract becomes irrefutable, irreversible and unalterable. This means\nthat all participates have very high confidence in execution surety of the\nprocess.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A hacker\nteam at the London FinTech Week utilized smart contracts to bag the the first\nprize. &nbsp;&nbsp;More than 560,000 airline passengers in the UK\ndo not claim on their insurance for delayed flights . The team made a smart\ncontract system that provides direct compensation for affected passengers\nwithout asking for it.&nbsp; &nbsp;The team was able to do so by connecting tons\nof online data feeds containing flight information to smart contracts in\nEthereum.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Ethereum platform, by some experts dubbed\nas \u2018Blockchain 2.0\u2019, is a programming framework to allow a\nnetwork of peers to create and administer their own smart contracts, without a\ncentral authority.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It combines a blockchain network with a universal\nprogramming language that would allow users to invent whatever smart contract\nthey want.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These smart contracts, or apps, run exactly\nas programmed without any possibility of downtime, censorship, fraud or third\nparty interference. The apps are able to interact with one another and conduct\ntransactions in Ethereum\u2019s own cryptocurrency, called ether.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The platform even\nenables the design and issuance of one\u2019s own cryptocurrency, where you either\nset the total amount in circulation to a simple fixed amount, or let it\nfluctuate based on any programmed ruleset.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crowdfunding is the use\nof small amounts of capital from a large number of individuals to finance a new\nbusiness venture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WeiFund, &nbsp;is a non-profit, decentralized crowdfunding\nplatform built on Ethereum. Because of the blockchain, this \u2018Kickstarter in a\nbox\u2019 features lower fees and enhanced security. It\u2019s useful for launching\ntokens that can be used in new applications and protocols.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can launch a\ncampaign using one of WeiFund\u2019s contract templates or integrate your own smart\ncontracts. The WeiFund contracts implement the core mechanics of crowdfunding;\ncontributions with refunds if the campaign objective isn\u2019t met.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The WeiFund web\napp makes it easy to start accepting contributions, and has hooks to allow you\nto reuse the user interface with custom contracts, if necessary.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crowdfunding\nis the practice of funding a project or venture by raising many small amounts\nof money from a large number of people, typically via the Internet. &nbsp;Crowdfunding is a form of crowdsourcing and of\nalternative finance. &nbsp;&nbsp;In a year\nworldwide more than 36 billion USD is raised this way. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term crowdfunding refers to\nInternet-mediated registries. Crowdfunding has been used to fund a wide range\nfor-profit entrepreneurial ventures such as artistic and creative projects,\nmedical expenses, travel, or community-oriented social entrepreneurship\nprojects .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crowdfunding is restricted by regulations on who is allowed to fund\na new business and how much they are allowed to contribute. Similar to the\nrestrictions on hedge fund investing, these regulations are supposed to protect\nunsophisticated or non-wealthy investors from putting too much of their savings\nat risk.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because so many new businesses fail, their investors face a high risk\nof losing their principal. Crowdfunding provides a forum to anyone with an idea\nto pitch it in front of waiting investors.. Investors can select from a\nhundreds of projects and invest as little as $10.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crowdfunding sites generate\nrevenue from a percentage of the funds raised. New video games are a popular\ncrowdfunding investment for gamers, who are rewarded with advance copies of the\ngame.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Equity-based crowdfunding is growing in popularity because it allows\nstartup companies to raise money without giving up control to venture capital\ninvestors, and it offers investors the opportunity to earn an equity position\nin the venture. Investments in equity-based crowdfunding ventures are regulated\nby the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The burden of\ninvestment is distributed across the masses. This is so that no single person\nhas to spend more than they can spare. Also, there are instances where artists,\nauthors, philosophers have crowdfunded their works.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those who participate in\ndonation-based crowdfunding campaigns do not expect in return for their\ncontribution. It is not the same with the rest. In reward-based crowdfunding,\nthe contributors expect certain rewards in recognition of their contributions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, ventures opting for equity-based crowdfunding are expected to give a\nshare of equity to its backers against their contributions. Also, certain\ncrowdfunding campaigns on the platform have predefined goals, which if not met\nwill leave the whole campaign void.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blockchain technology is perfectly capable\nof managing value exchange under contract. The feature that will come handy\nwhen it comes to managing rewards based and equity-based crowdfunding\ncampaigns.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole process of assigning relevant rewards and equity against\ntheir contributions can be automated, using blockchain based smart contracts\nfor crowdfunding..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By programming a set of pre-defined crowdfunding conditions\non smart contracts, the system can be automated to execute the smart contract\nto issue certain rewards or proof of ownership of a certain percentage of\nequity based on the amount contributed towards the campaign.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crowdfunding is\none segment, into which the blockchain technology is capable of blending in,\ncompletely.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/n5v4HRrpAoQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/n5v4HRrpAoQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>Be careful with smart fuckin'&nbsp; contracts that pay out automatically when an\narson is committed and a person is killed <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>JEW ROTHSCHILD IS DROOLING---&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>HE HAS\nSUPPORTED BOTH SIDES IN EVERY WAR SINCE THE BATTLE OF WATERLOO AND MILKED BOTH\nSIDES\u2014INCLUDING NEUTRAL NATIONS</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts actually present a lot of\nopportunities for crime<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Initial coin offering (ICO) is an unregulated\nand controversial means of crowdfunding via use of cryptocurrency, which can\nbe a source of capital for startup companies. In an ICO a percentage of the\nnewly issued cryptocurrency is sold to investors in exchange for legal tender\nor other cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An Initial Coin Offering (ICO) is used by\nstartups to bypass the rigorous and regulated capital-raising process required\nby venture capitalists or banks. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\"Lust\" is an initial coin offering\nbased on the Ethereum blockchain platform, designed for prostitutes and their\ncustomers to exchange money for sexual services.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It uses smart contracts and anonymity\nfeatures to escrow funding of the parties and keep their identities private, in\norder to avoid law-enforcement scrutiny and public shaming.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Many ICOs \u2013 through which cryptographic\ntokens are sold to fund the bootstrapping and development of a new blockchain\nnetwork \u2013 are \"absolute scams.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The risk of fraud is worse than in the heyday\nof penny stock scams.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Penny stocks,&nbsp;\nare common shares of small public companies that trade at low prices per\nshare<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Income Tax (I-T) department has launched\ncriminal prosecution against shell companies, stock brokers, beneficiaries and\noperators involved in laundering over Rs 10,000 crore in Mumbai alone by\nmanipulating listed penny stocks to claim bogus long term capital gain (LTCG)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Penny stocks are shares of companies that\nhave market capitalization (market capitalization-the total value or worth of\nthe company) less than Rs.100 crore and each share trading below Rs.10.&nbsp;&nbsp; Do you know how many penny stocks trade on\nBSE or NSE. It\u2019s 25% for the BSE and 10% for the NSE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the United States, the U.S. Securities and\nExchange Commission (SEC) defines a penny stock as a security that trades below\n$5-per-share, is not listed on a national exchange, and fails to meet other\nspecific criteria.&nbsp;&nbsp; In the United\nKingdom, stocks priced under \u00a31 are called penny shares.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Fraud is widespread in the penny stock\nmarket. Even though the penny stock companies are small, the scams that involve\nthem can be for tens of millions of dollars..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Unlike big stocks, penny stocks are more\nprone to manipulation.. Penny stocks trade at a relatively low price and have\nsmall market capitalisation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Penny stocks usually seem to belong to\ndubious promoters. These promoters sell their unworthy financial companies\nduring the peak period. Once they have off loaded their junk, they slowly\ndisappear from the light. The investors then get stuck with the bad\ninvestments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Penny stocks usually have a promoter-operator\nnexus. The promoters usually hire investment bankers (low reputed mostly).\nThese people in turn negotiate a deal with the operators who buy and sell\nshares anonymously with fake accounts. During boom times, people are ready to\nbuy anything.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These operators carefully create a media\nfrenzy or approach individual investors by mail/phone. They artificially push\nup prices and then offload these equity shares to investors. The profit is then\nshared between the promoter and operator.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Investors would have no idea as to what or\nhow much shares were insider traded nor how long stocks were held.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The I-T has alleged that Ruia laundered over\nRs 17 crore between 2012 and 2014 through Unno Industries Ltd, a listed penny\nstock and availed tax exemption by showing fake long term capital gains. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The I-T has alleged that Ruia later claimed\ntax exemption on the profit of Rs 17 crore he made through trading in the penny\nstock. The brokerage and the shell firms also received a commission of 4 to 6\nper cent from Ruia<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">. Many penny stocks, particularly those that\nsell for fractions of a cent, are thinly traded. They can become the target of\nstock promoters and manipulators. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">These manipulators first purchase large\nquantities of stock, then artificially inflate the share price through false\nand misleading positive statements. This is referred to as a pump and dump\nscheme. The pump and dump is a form of microcap stock fraud.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\"Pump-and-dump \u2013 it\u2019s actually easier\nhere than it is in the penny stock area, because it\u2019s all electronic, it\u2019s all\nanonymous, [and] it\u2019s harder to catch the bad guys at the end of the day<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Shell corporations have been used to commit\nfraud, by repeatedly creating an empty shell corporation with a name similar to\nexisting real corporations, then running up the price of the empty shell and\nsuddenly selling it (pump and dump) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An owned stock through false and misleading\npositive statements, in order to sell the cheaply purchased stock at a higher\nprice. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Once the operators of the scheme\n\"dump\" sell their overvalued shares, the price falls and investors\nlose their money. Stocks that are the subject of pump and dump schemes are\nsometimes called \"chop stocks\"&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As late as April 2001, before the\ncompany's collapse,<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b> Enron</b></span> executives participated in an elaborate scheme of\npump and dump, in addition to other illegal practices that fooled even the most\nexperienced analysts on Wall Street.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Similar to the \"pump and dump\"\nscheme, Fraudsters mislead investors in order to sell securities in the dummy\ncorporation, in this case, making investors incorrectly believe \"that they\nare buying shares in the real corporation\". The selling of risky\nsecurities through a fraudulent corporation is inherently illegal<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Very often, the perpetrator will claim to\nhave \"inside\" information about impending news to persuade the\nunwitting investor to quickly buy the shares. When buying pressure pushes the\nshare price up, the rise in price entices more people to believe the hype and\nto buy shares as well. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Eventually the manipulators doing the\n\"pumping\" end up \"dumping\" when they sell their holdings.\nThe expanding use of the Internet and personal communication devices has made\npenny stock scams easier to perpetrate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">SEC released guidance noting that digital tokens\ncould be treated like securities, and were \"subject to the requirements of\nthe federal securities law\" under certain circumstances<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">China and South Korea have gone as far as\nbanning the use of the funding model altogether.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts within blockchain platforms\nhave a lot to offer, but lack of regulation and testing makes them a potential\nvulnerability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In 2016, the Decentralized Autonomous\nOrganization (DAO) announced that a hacker had exploited a vulnerability in\nEthereum, a blockchain platform utilized by the group. The total loss to the\nDAO was reported at $150 million.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The flaw was not in the blockchain platform\nitself, but rather in the smart contract. The hacker was able to trigger a\nrecursive send vulnerability where the act of sending funds triggered another\n\u201csend funds\u201d request.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Etherium had done exactly what it was supposed to do, but\na loophole in the smart contract code exposed the organization to a hack. It\nwas reported that the DAO lost $60 million in just the first 12 hours.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Smart contracts are independent, which means\nthey obey only their own code and, once deployed, cannot be controlled by\neither the originator or any legal system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Additionally, they are irrevocable,\nand can only be replaced by a completely new contract.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\">Smart codes must be\nexhaustively tested for every potential outcome before India adopts it..&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">It is\nnot about CM Chandrababu Naidu baby trying to get his name into history records\nusing some Telugu KAMMA sidekicks from USA.</span></span> </span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Assessing technical maturity is a key component\nof a successful smart contract. When pursuing a solution, ask vendors five key\nquestions:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Are you certain that this contract cannot be\nundertaken using tried-and-tested and legally binding traditional contract\nmechanisms? If the answer is no, opt for the tested route.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Is anyone using the smart contract in\nproduction? If the answer is no then you may be putting your business or brand\nat risk by being the first. Are you sure you want to take that risk?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Do you, the smart contract creator, indemnify\nmy organization if there is a problem, including unexpected behavior or\nunintended consequences?&nbsp; &nbsp;If they do not, then it means that you are taking the\nrisk.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">What mechanisms for software assurance are in\nplace? Are there tools in place for mathematical proof of correctness? More to\nthe point, have they been applied to this smart contract, and where is the\nproof?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Under what circumstances are escape lanes\n(get-out/cessation clauses) used in the software, and who can invoke them \u2014 and\nwhy?&nbsp; &nbsp;Escape lanes can increase vulnerability to exploitation and require\nrigorous clarity or purpose and impact.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Enterprises should consider proven\ntraditional contracts when available and, if choosing smart contracts, ensure\nthat the code has been tested exhaustively.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Remember that there are no\nstandards for testing smart contracts, and having \u201cadequate\u201d testing exposes\nthe company to potential risk.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Finally, remember that it\u2019s impossible to see\nevery potential error or issue given the complexity of the technology, and at\nthe end of the process, the complexity could mean the contract fails to\nrepresent the original intentions of the signing parties.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Lower\noperating costs are the biggest beneficiary for insurers that utilize smart\ncontracts. Because the contract would be self-sufficient after its creation, no\ncostly human interaction would have to take place afterwards.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The self-executing character would greatly\nincrease speed and efficiency in claims processing. Smart contracts can avoid\nthe textual ambiguity of traditional contracts, preventing legal disputes.\nBecause the rules of the smart contract are programmed at creation, the\ncontract would only execute according to said rules.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot;
